Judy Know Football. Judy is a football player in high school. Judy has been practicing for the state finals all week. The night before the test Judy plays all her lines and gets ready. Judy gets her schedule to the test and does her best. The day of the test Judy gets a perfect score on the test.
The Touchdown. Josie was in the 5th quarter. She was running with the ball. Suddenly, she was tackled and knocked down. Her running back got up but couldn't. The team was losing.

Stamp Collection. Maggie collected stamps. She loved to see the stamps in her collection. She liked seeing them change color as she was mailed. She decided to start stamp-sending stamps every other week. It became quite a hobby for Maggie.

A common scenario. Allie went to a party with her friends. She ended up getting drunk. She started having a lot of sex with guys there. At the end of the night her friends had to go home. She realized her mistake and went home.
Tim buys a puppy. Tim wanted to get a pet. He knew his parents didn't like animals. He decided to buy a puppy. His parents didn't like the puppy. They grounded Tim for a week.

Court of Some Peels. There was a court in the park that the kids would often go to. One day, it was the kids' turn to pick the peels. They picked the peels and stacked them in a large pile. When the kids were done, they laid them down and peeled them. The peels were the color of peaches.

The Carnival. It was summer break and Sara was so excited to go to the carnival! She got ready for the biggest and best fun they had. She went to the rides and had a lot of fun. At the end of the day she went home. Sara couldn't wait for the next carnival trip.
Lottery. Linda went to the store to buy some wine. She needed to buy a $40 ticket. But they were all sold out. She decided to go to a different store. But when she arrived, there was nothing for her.

Luke. Luke was a great guy, but he would only date his best friends. He liked to take care of everyone, so he started a charity. He would donate whatever he made to the organization. Luke started a huge amount of money for the organization. The next day Luke got drunk and told all his friends to run away.

No Perfect Dress. Karen was going to her niece's wedding. Karen had been asked to be the maid of honor. She tried to buy a dress, but it was way too expensive. She decided to make her own. She made a beautiful, homemade gown for the event.

Sand Castles. Beth wanted to learn how to make sand castles. She didn't know what to start. Beth bought a book on how to make sand castles. Beth read the book and practiced her skills. Beth built a sand castle that was bigger than her whole house.
Rainy Day. It was raining out at Bob's house. Bob's power went out. Bob's family ran out to his car. They didn't have power for awhile. They had to walk to Bob's house.
Kim's Son's Glasses. Kim had lost her son's glasses. She took them to the eye doctor. The doctor gave her an exam. She got her son an eye exam. The doctor replaced her glasses.
Fixing the roof. It was raining really hard outside. Tom's roof was a mess. He called his friends over to help. They all had a lot of fun working on it. They were glad they were able to help.
Shoes. Tom loved walking barefoot. He decided to get a good pair of shoes. Tom shopped at his local shoe store. He looked at shoes for a while. He found the perfect pair.

The Boy's Dog. When Sam and his father first met, Sam thought his dad was an animal. When he grew older, he learned he was adopted. His dad was a great dog, but he wasn't allowed outside much. Sam would often go out and run and play in his dad's yard. But, his dad always had a fear of dogs, and Sam always had to go back.
Burning Down. I was cleaning my car. I stepped in a flame. I immediately screamed. I jumped out of my car. I ran back home, dazed and burned.

Ticket Hogger. Sam's dad got a speeding ticket for speeding. He was very angry and told his dad. The dad told Sam his dad was just following the rules. Sam was glad his dad told him that. Sam got his speeding ticket slashed to a mere warning.

Pokemon Hunting. Kyle was bored and wanted to do something exciting. He looked online to see what was happening in his local park. He found a pokemon area with a bunch of Pokestops. He checked each one out and took a bunch of pictures. He felt really accomplished.
Poor Clark. Clark was poor. He lived in a trailer. There was a flood on his street. He was scared to get out of the house. He slept on the floor and watched cartoons until it was over.

Wet Phone. I was playing football with my friends. We were running down the field. I slipped and fell on the wet field. My phone fell on the ground and was wet. I called my mother and she came to pick me up.

Picky Much?. The teacher explained the new material today. The kids all went home to get their books. When they got home, they were able to read the chapters they had. Although it was tedious, they had fun reading it. They decided to do the same thing the next time they visited.

Street Racing. Tim and his friend were driving down the street. Tim tried to avoid a car in front of him. The car kept going faster and faster. Tim was able to make it to a police car in the next lane. The police officer told Tim he had to wait until he was safe.

Tooth Fairy. Tommy always got his teeth checked when his parents were gone. Sometimes his parents let him choose the tooth fairy. One day he wasn't having it and chose a toothless girl. Her tooth fell out and was lost. Tommy cried all night.
beans. Heather bought some beans. Heather got hungry and went out to get some food. While out she saw a homeless man. The man was crying. Heather gave him some of her beans.

Odd habit. My friend has a weird habit. It involves rolling up and dropping things. The first time I saw him doing it he was drunk. He also had a large stick in his hand. It got stuck in his front door and he was in trouble.

Grades. I applied for my college courses. I was required to complete three courses. However, I did not know what was in the three courses. I was confused about the course requirements. I had to find a good college partner for the courses.

Walker Gets Organized. Walker's kids were fighting with one another. Walker decided that he would separate the two. Walker set a time for them to calm down. At the time, he had forgotten the time. Walker was angry that he had to wait so long to separate the kids.

Science Project. Gwen really wanted to be able to make a simple science project. She tried to build a model volcano. It didn't turn out as well as she hoped. She decided that science was more interesting that fun. She learned that the two were not always mutually exclusive.

The Surprise Party. I had a birthday party at work. My boss brought out some cake. He handed out a card with my name on it. My boss asked me to get coffee from him. I told him I was going home right away.

Too much work. My sister had a small wedding. She invited her family and friends. They needed lots of help. They all spent hours on the job. When it was time to hand in the wedding, we were very tired.

Hula Hoops. Lisa and Beth took the girls to the beach. They went to the park to play hula hoops. The girls played for hours. By the time they were done, they had learned a lot. The girls were happy to be able to hang out after all that fun.

the Freeloader. Bill had recently divorced his wife. Bill's son was an alcoholic and needed some help. He decided to find a new job and seek help. Bill found another job and began freeloading. He stopped living with his ex-wife and began living with his son.

The world. Ana lived on a farm in Nebraska. One day, her parents said it was time to go home. Ana thought it was time to leave, too. When she asked her dad, he said no. Ana was sad because she had spent a lot of time with her parents.
Bad Reception. Bryan was trying to call home. The reception was broken. He tried to fix it himself. He was unsuccessful. His phone had a voice over internet protocol error.
Eli. Eli is the new kid at school. He has never done anything risky. Today is his first day. He runs to his room and climbs into bed with a book. Eli has a great first day at school!

Running on Fumes. The air conditioner in my apartment building was broken. I didn't have any air filters. I ran my air conditioner on some old deodorant. It worked very well until it began to smell bad. The smell was very strong and I had to run it off to clean it.

kittens. One morning, while walking in the park, I encountered a cat. It was small and brown and white, and very cute! I kept my eye on it, and it followed me around the park. I decided to play with it for about an hour, but it escaped! I found the cat later in my mom's house, and was very happy.

the graveyard. Annie was walking down the graveyard when she saw a body. She looked up and saw it was a dead body. It wasn't at all what she expected. She walked around a bit to see what was going on. It was just a body being moved for some medical testing.

The Bagel. The bagel was the life of a diner. It always had the right amount of toppings. They made new bagels with new flavors. Some people were sad they didn't get their favorite toppings. It was like a family reunion every week.

Pancakes with Grandma. Jill was making breakfast for her family. She wasn't sure what she wanted. She looked up recipes online. Then she decided on a family favorite. Jill made pancakes with her grandma.

Overtime. I am always tired in the middle of the night. My alarm clock doesn't go off very often. The last time I was so tired I slept right into it. Now, the alarm clock goes off every 30 minutes. I have been waking up at 10 AM with an extra 10 minutes of work!
The Scary Car. Tom was driving home. It was dark. Tom's car was driving very fast. He had to slow down. Tom's car made a loud noise.

Rainy Vacation. Kate and her husband went on a rainy vacation. But Kate's car broke down. She and her husband had to walk to the car store. When they got there, it started to rain. Kate and her husband had to go home.

The Cookie Exchange. Janet went to the school cookie exchange. She saw a cute girl that she had a crush on. She decided to ask her out. She gave her the name of the girl. The girl accepted and they became friends.
Cereal. Bella had cereal for breakfast. She poured her bowl of cereal. After she bit into a piece, she threw up. Bella then threw up again. She was sick for the whole day.

Scuba diving. Karen went scuba diving with her family one day. Karen loved going scuba diving and couldn't wait to dive again! Unfortunately, her family went on vacation for the week. The trip had to be postponed due to weather concerns. Luckily, Karen had a great time at the beach on the weekend.

The Dry Milk. Linda was making a strawberry cheesecake. She left the milk out overnight. When she got it out, she realized it was very dry. She looked up her mistake and realized she used too much milk. She brought the cheesecake back to the kitchen and fixed it.

Vladimir Plays Pool. Vladimir was playing pool at the bar. He had a bad game last night. This morning he decided to play one more game. He won two more games in a row. At the end of the day Vladimir was very happy.

Playing graveyard. I always wanted to play graveyard in a board game. I looked online and found a group of people that did it. We met at a local graveyard. They set up the game and we began. We ended up doing fine, it was good fun.

Accident at Home. Lucy was at home when she heard loud noises. She didn't know where they came from. She ran out to investigate the noise. Her neighbors dog had run into her house. She had to call animal control.

Justin breaks down. Justin was driving down the road. His engine was making noises. He pulled over to check out what was wrong. He started it up again and went back home. He drove back home and fixed the engine.

Cathy's Garden. Cathy had just planted some vegetables. She planted carrots, peppers, onions, and squash. As she was about to harvest them she got a call. Her neighbor called her to say they were out of lettuce. She quickly ran to the store and bought some lettuce.

Favorite Letter. Jill was at the zoo with her friends. They were playing catch in the sand box. Jill tossed the ball over her shoulder. The ball sailed over the fence. Jill's favorite letter from the teacher was in the sand.

Head Stuck. It was late in the afternoon. Gina had been in traffic for three hours. The road was covered in construction detritus. Gina was stuck in traffic for another hour. The traffic light finally came on.
Lost CD. Kim bought a new CD at the store. She gave it to her friend. Kim lost it in her car. Kim had to borrow another CD. Kim was upset the CD wouldn't play again.

cringey LDR. Sheila had a boyfriend she was trying to get to know. Her boyfriend's parents knew she was dating someone. Her boyfriend's parents disapproved of her having any contact. Sheila went to confront them directly. They understood, and the LDR ended.

Losing Faith. My daughter's college roommate just moved out. She had to start a job in another town. She tried to contact me, but I haven't heard from her in 3 months. She called me and said she was going to get married. I called the college to confirm she's still in and I'm hopeful.

Woods. John and his friends went hiking in the woods. They were having a great time when they got lost. They began to panic when they realized they were lost. They ran through the woods until they could find their friends. They decided to never hike alone again.

Alex's Sickness. Alex woke up with a bad headache and felt light headed. He decided to go for a run. Alex ran to the park. The grass was so hot that it made him sweat. Alex made it to the park, but was still very tired.

Don't Do It. Amy was upset because her friend Jess was annoying her. She said Jess would do something dangerous. So Amy started writing to Jess. Her friend Jess heard about the letter. Jess ignored Amy and gossiped about her in the halls.

Ken's First Day. Ken was looking forward to going to school one morning. He had a large bag of supplies with him that morning. When Ken awoke the next morning he saw his backpack ripped open. Ken felt very confused and started to cry. Ken's mom was angry that he was in the middle of school.
Not crazy. I have to go to a doctor to get a flu shot. I really want the flu shot. I do not want to get the flu shot. I just need to be sure I do not get the flu. I can't believe how scared I am.
Protest. I went to the office today. I wanted to protest the firing of a manager. I found out I was not eligible to join. I left the office in tears. I didn't know if I'd ever be able to join again.
Fate. The man blamed the circumstances. He blamed himself. He never changed. He didn't change the circumstances. He continued to blame himself for his actions.

Tom and the Turtles. Tom was at the zoo with his friends. They were watching some really cool turtles. Suddenly, a huge male stepped up and grabbed the turtle! Tom got really scared and quickly left the area. His friends all laughed and told him to be quiet.

The Lasagna. Cindy loved her family's lasagna. They would always make it for her. She would always ask them to try new recipes. One day she had a craving for spaghetti but her family was busy. She was very sad when they ate their lasagna.

Nurse Talitha. Talitha wanted to be a nurse. She had not studied very hard for nursing school. Talitha's first attempt at nursing school was a failure. Talitha was discouraged, and continued to work as a nurse. Talitha graduated from nursing school the next year.

Lost and resentful. Troy's mom tried to convince him to take swimming lessons. He got a new job that required a lot of commuting. Troy felt guilty about not taking swimming lessons. He took a swim in the pool one day and was so tired the next day. After taking lessons again, Troy's mom was happy with how he was behaving.

Swimming team. Jenna wanted to join the swimming team at her school. Her friend Beth agreed to help her practice. Jenna and Beth practiced for two weeks. Jenna and Beth tried out for the team on the last day of tryouts. Jenna made the team.
Campaign. Tom was running for mayor. He ran against a rival mayor. He didn't advertise or raise money. Tom was a popular mayor. He won the election by a landslide.

Final Match. The final match of the tournament was tomorrow. My team only has 10 players left. The last team member, Dan, is disqualified. My team is disbanded. We still won the tournament but lost it by a few points.
Painting. The kids were painting the backyard. The mom went to help her kids. The kids ran off and cried. The mom stopped painting. The kids started crying again.

Lindsey's first drive. Lindsey's dad took her to the DMV to get her license. She was so nervous that she was driving with no training wheels. Lindsey didn't notice that her brake lights had come on. She hit a parked car as hard as she could. She ended up having to wait to get it fixed.

Karen makes a sandwich. Karen had been having terrible stomach aches all week. She had missed the school bus and was stuck in bed with no food! When she got home, she knew that she should eat. She made herself a big sandwich and some lettuce and tomato. Karen sat down and felt better quickly!

Ron Buys A Phone. Ron decided that he needed a new phone. He went to his local phone store and found a nice phone for $200. Ron then went online and ordered a new phone. Ron picked out the phone and set up his account online. Ron was happy to have a new phone.

Moving. Katherine moved to another state. She moved across the country. The first state she left her family wasn't welcoming her. She went to a bar and talked to people for awhile. After a while she realized her family was more welcoming.

Key. Mary needed a key to her car. She checked her purse but didn't find it. Mary went to the store and bought a key. Mary tried to start her car, but the key wouldn't work. Mary had to call the auto club for assistance.

Ten Year Reunion. Tim was attending a ten year high school reunion. It was time to invite some old friends. Tim didn't have any plans to go with. He decided to just sit around the tables and eat and watch football. Tim was happy when he finally did go with his old friends.

Cleaned Out. Bob went to the bank to deposit some cash. The teller asked him for his ID. The ID was already taken so he used a fake ID. The teller thought that it was odd for someone to fake a ID. Bob didn't bother to change anything since he had already paid.

Summer dreams destroyed. Julie had a summer of shopping, partying and fun. She didn't realize how much the sun hurt her skin. She was in such a good mood, she didn't notice the sun. When it was too much, she went to lay in the shade. Julie slept soundly the rest of the day, despite the pain.
Inconsiderate Neighbor. A neighbor complained about my music. I played music all day long. A few neighbors complained about my music. I left early that day. I went to a garage to make music.

Hide and Go. The teacher pulled her desk out of the room. She took a few books and put them in her desk. Her student looked at her books with a confused expression. She was confused because she had no idea what books were theirs. The teacher told her to be quiet.

Overwhelmed by technology. Tim's parents were always pushing him to buy new things. Tim tried to resist, but he wanted a new computer. Tim was finally forced to buy it. He loved it at first, but soon he found it was slow and ugly. Tim wished he had never bought it, but wished he had listened more.
Crazy Neighbors. Kendall was very lonely. She wanted to meet someone. A man invited her over for coffee. He had an axe and threatened to kill her. Kendall was so scared she immediately ran away.
Back Pain. I was working hard in the gym. I was going through heavy bench press presses. My back started to hurt. I decided to stop benching. My back was no longer hurting.

True Challenge. Sam wanted to play baseball. He did not try out for the team this year. So he decided to join the youth team. He made the team in his second tryout. He tried out again the next year and made the team.

Linda loses. Linda was shopping with her daughter in an aisle. Linda was a mother of three young children. Linda asked her daughter what they were going to buy her for Christmas. Her daughter told her they were going to buy her a new dress. Linda found the dress on sale online for $40 and bought it.

Stranded Island. I was on vacation in Florida with some friends. I was walking through the beach with them one afternoon. I started to feel seasick and realized that I had never been there. I thought for sure I would never make it home. Luckily, I made it just in time and made it to the hotel.
Social Media. Lars was a successful rapper. He had many fans online. Lars had an account on Snapchat. One day Lars posted a video on Snapchat. The video went viral and Lars lost all of his fans.

Nick and the Doll. Nick wanted a doll for his birthday. His mom told him not to ask for it. Nick made his wish, and his wish came true! On Nick's birthday, he got a doll of his favorite character. Nick's mom was glad she had made his wish come true.
Drinking. Tom had a drinking problem. He went to a doctor. The doctor told him to stop drinking. Tom started drinking less. He was healthier by drinking less.

Old Bed. Jake's bed was starting to give him problems. It wouldn't stop creaking at all. Eventually he decided to go to the shop to see what they could do. They told him he needed an old mattress, which he was okay with. He ended up sleeping in a new, comfortable bed all night.

Slump. My sister-in-law Jane is not a fan of cats. She was in her 90s and had had a cat, she was sick of cats. She did not think she could care for a cat, but she has. Last week, Jane got a call saying a cat had passed away. Jane is now contemplating living with a cat, though.
Fun pizza party. Allie decided to have a pizza party. She was rather excited. As soon as she got there though something happened. Her friends didn't want to come. Allie was disappointed.

Celebrity Look-alike. Kim had a cousin that resembled Kim. They had the same birthday, same shoes, and even the same name. Kim's cousin was going to be at a concert at the same venue. Kim had to work extra hard to be able to look like Kim's cousin. She went to the store to buy a dress to look like Kim's cousin.

Gun. Nina had a gun collection. She didn't know what to get her parents for Christmas. She searched through magazines and online. Eventually, she chose a cool-looking gun. Her parents loved her thoughtful gift!

Snake in the Yard. Jake saw something move in the yard. He screamed and called the neighbors. The neighbor came and got the snake out of the yard. Jake was amazed and relieved. Jake went back inside to take a bath.

Math Tutor. Molly had a math tutor who told her she needed to work harder. Molly refused to work harder. The math tutor called her parents. The parents came to the tutor's house. The parents found Molly's tutoring had become untidy.

Prom Night. Jake always had a crush on Jenny. One day, she asked him to go to prom with her. Jake accepted the invitation. He got a bunch of girls together for a sleepover. Jake got to dance all night with the prettiest girls in school.

Iron. Bill was running late for work. But his wife insisted he change into clean clothes! She took the iron out of its case and set it aside. But then she saw that it had gone missing. She took it back and found the iron under the sink!

Goodbye Love. The woman was about to be married. She found someone who was good to her. The woman began to be jealous. The woman threw a party for her husband. He still did not love her and the marriage was over.

No Money No Honey. Jane needed money. But her mother only had $15. Jane was sad she couldn't find a job. So she decided to steal some honey from a store. The store manager caught Jane and sent her to jail.

Erin and the TV. Erin was on a trip. She was on the bus to a new city. Erin forgot her cell phone at home. Erin got stuck with the television. She was embarrassed until she remembered her phone at home.

Old Stove. Kerry wanted to start cooking dinner. She went to the store and bought some stoves. When she got home, she tried to put it together. She was surprised to find she had no experience assembling anything. She was very angry at herself.

Book of Mormon. The family went on a vacation. They stopped at a book store to purchase a book of Mormon. They searched the book store for hours and found nothing. They decided to leave the store, and never returned. The family decided that the book of Mormon was a complete waste.

The College. Carson was very excited to attend college. He was not sure where to attend. He searched the internet for some good schools. He decided to attend Texas A&M University. Carson made lots of friends at his new college.
baby. I used to have a kid. One day my daughter fell out of the sky. I had to rush to the hospital. I had to stay for three days. After that I never had another kid.
Glare. I turned the TV on. The television had some terrible glare problems. I turned on the remote control. The remote control was not working. I turned on the light instead.

Where is my refund?. I purchased my new iPad from Apple yesterday. The box showed the item as already shipped. When I looked in the back of the box the box was not there. I contacted customer service and requested a refund. They gave me an email address to send them a refund request.
dead dog. Timmy was playing with his dog. He left the gate open. His dog got out. It ran into the street. Timmy was scared.

Seriously, They're Everywhere. Gina's parents thought she didn't understand the difference between fiction and nonfiction. She was reading a book about dragons and mythical creatures. But the book had a very realistic story-line. Her parents had to explain that books written in a different language were still fiction. Gina didn't understand it, but she didn't mind.

Samuel's sandwich. Samuel was hungry. He decided to make himself a sandwich. Samuel went into the kitchen to make a sandwich. He was distracted by an advertisement. The sandwich didn't come out correctly.

A miscommunication. Jane and her husband were arguing over dinner. Jane had served spaghetti to her husband and he was hungry. Jane had spaghetti on the menu but forgot to put sauce on it. She was confused, and put the spaghetti on her husband's plate. He ate it for dinner and said it was delicious!
Infection. Tom was on a flight. He was getting really sick. He complained about his food. The flight attendant helped him. Tom was able to rest.

Picking just one. I have a list of things I need to buy. One item is a pair of pants that I want, but it is very expensive. I ask the clerk if there is a way to get the pants. She suggest I get a discount at the store. I am happy that the clerk thinks I should buy the pants.
maracas. Nate went to the store. He wanted to buy some maracas. But he did not have enough money. He ended up getting it at a dollar a bottle. He bought some, and it was delicious.
Jam or jelly. Joe wanted to make some jelly. So Joe got some jelly from the store. Joe set his jar up to make jam. Joe mixed the jelly in his mixer. Joe made jam.
The Manual. John was using a manual at his job. He was very careful with it. It kept his boss happy. John's boss made him pay more attention to it. John used it more often.

Forgetful Sam. Sam was a young boy. He always forgot to put his pants on before going to bed. He would try to keep them on when his mom told him not to. One night his mom woke him and told him he couldn't wear his pants. Sam cried because he had no pants to wear.
Cold Soup. Tom was a picky eater. He only ate cold vegetables. He loved soup but didn't like the taste. He bought a big bag of soup from the store. Tom ate so much he became sick in the end.

Wednesdays. Jim's dad is out of town this week. He's been looking forward to this for a week. His mom said the day before he got off work he should buy some things. Jim decided to buy his dad a new hat. He wore the hat to his dad's funeral.

Hiking Trip. Sally and her family went hiking. Sally accidentally stepped on a rattlesnake. Her and her siblings freaked out and started running. Sally's mother tried to calm them down. They finished the hike and had fun talking about the rattlesnake.

Every time. Everytime I went to see my brother, he would laugh. He was always laughing so hard. He would have two of his teeth come out. He would cry and say his two teeth were hurting. It was a big problem.

Salty. The man placed a piece of cheese in his mouth. He spit it out after chewing. The cheese was too salty for his liking. He tried to chew it but it tasted too salty. He spat it out and spit it out again.

Over-reacting. The teacher told the class that there was no candy today. Since she was very tired, she asked the kids to take a break. When the bell rung, she tried to wait until the bell rung before walking. She walked on the bus instead of walking. The students tried to laugh.
Ironing Clothes. John was ironing his clothes. All of a sudden he tripped on a rock. He fell on his hands. His hands were red. John felt bad.
Lizzie's Locks. Lizzie had a problem. She lost her keys. She had to look for her keys everywhere. She searched her room for hours. She finally found her keys in her dresser.

Jacob's Lawn. Jacob has very long grass. Jacob went to his friend's house to play a game of basketball. His friend told Jacob to take the grass down to the sidewalk. Jacob laid down the basketball on the grass. Jacob had fun playing with his friend's yard.

Banana Split. Beth and Mark wanted to have a delicious banana split. Mark suggested they have it on french toast. Beth thought that would be too boring. Mark changed his mind and added fruit. It was the perfect treat!
Speech. My teacher gave us instructions to practice a speech. I decided to speak without thinking. I was rather nervous. When I got up to speak I was fine. I didn't remember to copy any instructions.

Snacker. Gina and her friends were walking through the park. It was the day before summer break and they wanted to go to the store. But they couldn't decide where they wanted to go. Finally they decided to go to the convenience store. They could now go to their favorite ice cream parlor.
Sushi. My wife loves Japanese food. She decided to try some sushi for the first time. It was amazing! She immediately ordered more. She will make it a daily habit!

Last Work Sandwich. Tim made the last work sandwich of the day. He took it to the table with a sigh. Everyone made a joke about how he was always late. Tim felt guilty, so he pretended to be sick. Everyone just laughed, and the last sandwich was a hit.
Clark Watches Birds. Clark is walking through the park. Clark sees many beautiful birds. Clark looks around the park. Clark spots a beautiful blue bird. Clark watches the bird fly away.
Egg. The man cracked an egg. He wanted to have a nice breakfast. He cracked an egg. The egg cracked. He had a bowl of cereal instead.

Not Realizing. My teacher came into my class. She told everyone to come to her. Afterwards, she asked my parents if they can babysit. I refused to let her go since I didn't want to miss class. She was mad since she couldn't see me for several minutes.

Best in Class. I always got better in class than my friends. I had a test coming up and I was really worried about it. The next day I went home and got ready for school. I studied so much I got an A on my test. It made me really happy that I studied so much.

Trip to Australia. Ally was planning a trip to Australia. She was taking a lot of photos. When she got there she decided to take a trip out. A few days later Ally got sick. She was not able to take photos after that.

Our New Kayaks. After months of shopping, the family decided to buy a new kayak. They decided on a silver one that was large and blue. They drove over to the river bank and waited. Soon the water was too rough and the kayaks rocked. They decided to buy a smaller, slower boat and go for a ride.
The actor. Kevin was a very funny man. He would tell so many jokes. One day, he decided to star in a movie. He wrote a script. He acted in the movie.

Kiera. Kiera had been a good girl, but she felt very lonely. She wanted a pet, so she went to the pet store. There, she found the perfect pet: a new fish! She named her new pet Rufus, and they lived happily ever after. Kiera felt very happy to have found a good friend.
parking ticket. Jim was late for his meeting. He was already late. He went to park at the curb and waited for his turn. Jim got the ticket from the meter. He had to pay a large fine.

Ruts. There were so many ruts in the road I couldn't see. I was driving on the highway at the time. There were a bunch of ruts on the road. I was nervous because I had never done it before. I kept my eyes open and made it safely home.
The Pizza. James wanted to make pizza. He put all the ingredients on the counter. James then realized that the dough was dry. He had forgotten to add salt! James's pizza turned out just perfect.
New calculator. I bought a new calculator last week. It's very accurate and accurate. However I do not like the way it looks. It has small print on it. I bought a black one instead.

Giant Squid. I have always wanted to try a giant squid. I decided I was going to go to a sushi restaurant and buy one. While I was in the restaurant, I saw an odd looking fish. My mind immediately went to how disgusting the fish was. I never returned to the sushi restaurant ever since.

Gorilla. The gorilla looked out at the zoo and saw some tourists. He watched them and then ran to the gorilla enclosures. He jumped in and then started to climb the tall trees. The gorillas heard him and all of a sudden looked up. There were kids chasing them and they were gone.

Sid is the life of the party. Sid loves to party all the time. One night at a party he invited a bunch of people. He didn't tell them they couldn't come. He took them all out to the alley to party. They all had a lot of fun.

Skateboarding. Sam loved to rollerblade. One day, he decided to go outside to skate. On his way, he fell off his skateboard. He scraped his knees pretty bad. Eventually, he decided to wear his knee pads.

President. Gina had been talking to her grandma about running for class president. Now that she was the president she was making new friends. She decided to spend the week planning a new game show challenge. Gina had already planned the theme and cast for the show. She had to work hard to make all the requirements for the game show.
Wild Jump. Tom was jumping fences. He was running up and down them. He was running fast enough that he didn't see the dog. His dog ran after him. Tom's dog took him off.

Mike is stuck. Mike is in the middle of a road. He is trying to drive home. Mike notices a truck coming towards him. Mike tries to avoid the truck. He ends up falling out of the road and onto his head.

Sneaking In. Lola wanted to sneak into her friend's room. She carefully walked inside the room, avoiding the girls. She peered in the window to get a better look at them. The window was locked so she opened it from the outside. Her friend was sitting in the bed with the window open.

Virginia Beach. Tim's friends were in town for the weekend. They all wanted to spend time together. They all decided to go to Virginia Beach. They all went to the beach and spent time together. They had a great weekend.
Learning how to cook. I have been learning how to cook all week. So far, I am not very good. I am still learning, though. I am trying to practice a lot. I hope that eventually I get the hang of it.

Promotion. Drew was a new manager at a fast food restaurant. Drew was working hard for the promotion. He came in the office and handed out flyers to the workers. Many of the workers showed up. Drew was promoted to the management position.
Stephen gets bullied. Stephen is being bullied by a group of kids. Stephen runs and hides. Stephen tries to run to freedom. He is stopped by the bullies. Stephen gets beaten up by his friends.

Sports. Sally was obsessed with sports. She thought they were the most exciting thing around. She decided to try out for track and field. She did not make the team. Sally never cared about her obsession again.

Keeping Score. Bobby watched as the scorekeeper tallied the points on the board. He was having a lot of fun watching the game being played. He could not wait to be able to add his name to the score. Once the score was tallied, Bobby was finally able to add his name. Bobby was now a proud owner of a new board game.

Cat. Anna wanted a cat as a little girl. At age ten, her parents bought her a little white cat. She loved it so much, she decided to stay with it all her life. Anna spent her whole life with her cat. But when she turned 40, she decided it was time to let go.

Shuttle. Anna was on vacation in Italy. She was at the airport when she saw the shuttle. It was the last shuttle on the airport and she was excited. It had a different color than the shuttle she normally saw. Anna was surprised and happy to be going on a different shuttle.

Mutual Attraction. Dana and Bob were having an affair. It was a hot topic in the office. One day, Dana found out that Bob had been cheating on him. Dana decided it was time for her to end things with Bob. They were both saddened at the end of the affair.

Jimmy Drops History Class. Jimmy had always wanted to be a history teacher. He was excited for his first day at the class. When Jimmy arrived he took out several of his books. He spent the majority of the day reading over the syllabus. Jimmy felt disappointed when he walked out the classroom.
Chipped tooth. Marge was eating cereal. She bit into a piece of cereal. The cereal had chipped her tooth. She began to cry. She put ice on it and the chipped tooth became pink.
Games. I went to play a board game last week. We went to a casino. We put on some board games and had a lot of fun. I lost a lot of money though. That was fun though, and I enjoyed my day.

Digging. Joe wanted to dig a hole for his backyard play area. He dug very deep but didn't have enough dirt. He called his neighbor to see if she wanted to help dig. She said yes, and they spent the afternoon digging. Now they have a very good play area in their yard.

The Cheating. Charles' parents weren't happy with their son. They were sure Charles would be sent to boarding school. One day Charles came home with a bunch of money from school. They questioned him if he had taken it from their safe. Charles lied and said he hadn't stolen it.
Sandbox. We had to clean the garage. We had to clean it all out. There was dirt and stuff everywhere. We cleaned it out. We had a sandbox to play in.

The ice cream truck. The ice cream truck stopped outside my house. It was empty. I went inside to search for something to eat. I went to the freezer and bought some stuff. I went back out and ordered more ice cream.

Jane Opens a Candy Shop. Jane wanted to open a small shop. She had a few crafts that she wanted to sell. She started her shop in a small shop on Main Street. The shop grew very quickly. Jane now owns two shops.
The Bar. I went to the bar for the first time. I walked over to the dance floor. Everyone was dancing. We had drinks. I got drunk and fell on the dance floor.

Lonely elders. Timothy never spoke to anyone in his family. So he felt like they didn't feel the need to go to church with him. When his mother's boyfriend came to visit, Timothy's mother was upset. The boyfriend tried to talk to Timothy but the preacher was preachy. And Timothy felt sad about not being invited to church with his family.

Taxi Fight. Randy got picked up at a red light by a taxi. He thought he got home in time, so he called his mom. She said the taxi was already leaving. Randy yelled at her. Her dad showed up to comfort him.
New Job. Tom wanted a new job. He was not qualified. He applied to many different ones. Eventually Tom was hired at a new job. It wasn't the job he wanted but it was better than nothing.
Alone away from home. Maggie was in her room. All of her friends were at the party. She couldn't find her friends. Then she noticed a light above her door. It was her friends.
Figure Skating. Samantha is a great skater. She decided to enter a skating competition. She practiced every day. On the day of the competition, she was ready. Samantha won second place.

Haircut. Molly wanted to get a new haircut. She went to the hair salon but she did not know what kind. She went in and told them what her hair style was. The hairdresser cut her hair very short. Molly is very happy with her new haircut.

Obvious but Truthful. Dan recently bought a new car. The car was a 1997 Mercury Montego. A lot of people on the street laughed at Dan's car. Dan was irritated and told them not to be so dismissive. Dan ended up buying a 1997 Pontiac GTO instead.

Limitless Embarrassment. The man tried to run over his girlfriend's head. She pulled up to the curb. The man took off his pants. His underwear got caught on the curb. He was embarrassed for a whole second.

Food Challenge. Jill's parents wanted to get her more exercise. She decided to challenge herself to a nutritious meal. Jill put together a meal that included everything a girl could eat. When it was all ready, she took it home and made a plate. She then proceeded to eat what she had made and felt tired all day.
Mountains. The man and his son went to a mountain. He wanted to climb on but he did not know how. He asked a friend of his to show him. His friend showed him how to climb. They got to the top.
Unknown Fees. Tom was not sure about his car. He wanted to make sure it was clean. He went to the mechanic. They were not able to help him. He had to pay to have it towed.

Bird. The cat chased the bird around the house. The bird got scared and flew away. The cat followed the bird until the bird was outside. The cat found the bird under a bush. The cat brought the bird back inside and kept it safe.

Candles. Ava's house is always full of candlelight. She gets tired of it, and makes plans to switch. She has started reading some candle safety books. She's also started buying candles in bulk. Now Ava's house is less full of candlelight.

Figure Skating. The girl was practicing for a figure skating competition. Her best trick was a perfect back flip. Her friend decided to show her how to do it too. Her friend let her borrow his skates. She was happy that she could practice for her competition.

Restaurant. Mary was in town and wanted to go to a new restaurant. She wanted to try the chicken breast, but it was over cooked. She tried it anyways and got sick very fast. She realized she shouldn't try new things if she doesn't want to. Mary tried the chicken and it wasn't so bad.

Last Minute Decision. Jane went to the supermarket and bought eggs for the week. The grocery store only had egg packets for breakfast. Jane had to make a difficult decision. She couldn't go out to lunch. Jane ended up just buying eggs for the week.
The Quota. The teacher asked everyone to read a few sentences. When they got done, the bell rang. The teacher was mad. She sent everyone to the principal's office. They were all written up.
Arrested. Cindy had a terrible temper. One day she got into an argument with a friend. A police officer showed up at her house. Cindy called her friend. She was arrested for domestic violence.

Pixy. Pixy was a happy girl. She wanted a puppy more than anything in the world. One day, her mom told her that she could get a puppy for free. Pixy was so happy that she didn't even cry. She named her new dog Rottweiler and took him home.

Presentation. It was time for me to give a presentation to my class. I looked over my notes and wrote down all of my ideas. After that, I went to my office and got my materials. I went to my class, got ready and sat down. When I came to class everyone was there to see me give my presentation.

Adoption. Kim's mom had wanted to adopt her since birth. But she just wasn't ready. She had to wait and see if they could adopt someone. One day her friend's adopted son came to visit. And he brought Kim to tears.

Sign Language. Amy wanted to learn to sign her name. Amy decided to take a trip to a sign language camp. At the camp she learned how to sign her name. Amy was happy to have found a way to sign her name. Amy felt proud of her acquisition.

Going Fishing. My friend and I went fishing in the middle of the woods. We found a spot with some good fish. We had a good time fishing. When we got home we found that one of our fish had a tetrapod. It had to be put back in the water.
Parking Spot. Tom was visiting his friends. They were all parked in a lot near a park. A huge storm had just come by. The park was flooded with water. Tom's friends all had to go out and get out.

Burned cookies. Suzy was making cookies for her friends. All of the sudden she started smelling something burning. She checked and realized that the cookies were burnt. Luckily she was able to make them into some cupcakes instead. They tasted better and were still delicious.
Risk. Ricky was playing at the carnival. He was on his favorite ride. Suddenly, his ticket ran out. He had to ride another ride. The ride was much more difficult.
Front step trout. The other day I went fishing on the front steps. The trout I caught were huge. They were black and white. I took them home and fried them. It was delicious.

Hillary is determined. Hillary is running for president. She tells the American people what she wants to do for them. She wants to help make America great again. She says she will work to build a wall along the southern border. She has won the election.

Purse envy. Derek really wanted a new pair of purse. His friend took the money he needed from his allowance. He got rid of the old purse and put in a new one. When he went shopping he tried the new purse on. He immediately dropped it in disgust.
The Catch. Sally was at a baseball game. A pitcher came up to her and threw her a curveball. She swung and swung but it was too hard. She missed. Luckily, she managed to catch it and run home.

teacher affair. Kim's mother had an affair with a teacher. Kim had a crush on the teacher. When the teacher saw her, she turned and slapped Kim. Kim was so mad and upset. Kim cried all night, thinking she would never be friends again.
Cowboy Doll. My daughter is turning three in June. Her mom bought her a cowgirl doll. It is brown with big red eyes. My daughter loves the doll. She has played with it every day.

Fish. My daughter's best friend has a fish. She has a goldfish and loves to play with it. Last night she left it alone and took it with her to the beach. It did not eat or drink from the water. The fish did not come back after she got home.
Wet Ending. Tom was driving to work. All of a sudden the windshield started to water. Tom swerved to avoid the water. He hit a guardrail and rolled through. Tom was stuck for a long time.
Gravy. He made his own gravy. It was delicious. He shared it with his son. His son wanted it again. He decided to make gravy for his family too.

Baby. Ivan's mom had a baby. Ivan was excited and anxious. He was afraid he might not be the father. Ivan was finally old enough to know his mom wasn't having another baby. Ivan was happy and relieved to learn he wasn't the dad.

The Eyesore. John bought a new house in a new neighborhood. He was so excited to have it in his own house. It didn't take long before he noticed things were a little out of place. The yard was a mess with lots of weeds and leaves. John bought some landscaping tools and went home.

The Thief. John was a hard working man. He worked at a warehouse and was looking for money. John went in and stole money from his safe. John went back out and made more money. John was so proud of himself.

Walking to school. Gina always walked to school by herself. But today, she was walking with a friend. She was sad that she didn't get to walk alone. But she knew her friend would be waiting for her at the bus stop. She was happy when she got to walk without her friends.

Jumping. Cathy was at the mall. She saw a fun store and decided to go in. At the store, Cathy saw a whole store full of jumping toys. Cathy begged her parents for a jump rope. Cathy was happy to finally have a jumping toy at the mall.

The Shopping Cart. Samantha loved doing yard work. She bought a really nice shopping cart. She took it to the garage to load all her stuff. Her kids decided to help with the yard work. The kids worked all day.
New iPad winning. Tina wanted the new iPad. So she went to the Apple store and bought one. But the line was very long. Finally she was able to get it. Tina was very happy.
The Pizza. It was a hot day. A pizza delivery man walked up to the house. He brought a pizza for everyone. The kids were happy. They took turns eating it all.

Sparklers. Lizzy needed sparklers for her birthday party. She drove to the store to buy some. She bought sparklers for all the friends in the party. She put the sparklers on the cake. She made them stand out with sparkle.

Classic car. Jim went to the car lot to buy a classic sports car. He saw a red one he liked and bought it. He drove it home and looked at the car. He thought it looked great. He kept the red classic car for himself.
The Game. Cathy loved to play football. Cathy was on the school's football team. Cathy played hard for her team. Cathy played a great game for her team. Cathy's team won the game for their home team.
Clara's Algebra. Clara's parents were always worried about her. She always failed algebra. She wanted to pass algebra. She studied all night long. After the next test she got her grade up to a B.

Getting Mugged. A man was walking down the street. He was carrying some cash. A man with a gun tried to grab it from him. The man fought back but the robber beat him up. The police came to look for the robber.

Cleaning Windows. Kim's car was dirty inside. She decided to clean it with a vacuum. She drove around the car and cleaned all of the surfaces. She then wiped down all of the windows. She then dried the windows by wiping them with a dry cloth.

Milk. Toby was a dairy farmer. He got a terrible cow to milk for the first time. Toby was so scared he didn't want to try it. But then he tried a tiny dribble of skim milk. Toby got over his fear, and enjoyed the skim milk!

What the Earthquake Made. When a large earthquake occurred near Tom's school, he felt scared. Tom went to the principal's office and explained to him what happened. The principal let him go home and tell his parents what happened. His parents decided to spend the day catching up on some news. Later that day, Tom heard the earthquake and went to his house.
Torn Socks. Tom was out at the park. He had a pair of black sneakers on. He decided to go for a run. Unfortunately he lost his shoes on the ground. Tom's sneakers became totally torn up.

The new friend. Sally moved to a new school. She went to a new school with a different group of friends. They got along very well. One of her new friends showed up with an extra shirt on. They hung out for the entire day.
Hangover. I've had a crazy day. I woke up feeling like a child. I decided to take a shower. It took me about thirty minutes. I was too tired to go out and play.

Beat the game. Joey and his friends wanted to play the game Monopoly. Joey decided to cheat. Joey pretended he was a millionaire and bought all the properties. Joey's friends played a game of Monopoly with him. Joey was finally beaten by his friends.

Home. Tom was unhappy in his home life. He had problems with anger management. He went to a counseling session. After that he tried to stay in control of his anger. He was happy with the results of the session.

Frozen Pizza. I went to buy frozen pizza for my family at the store. I had no idea what to get them since they were so expensive. I drove to a nearby market and found some good deals. I was able to get some decent pizzas for a much cheaper price. I brought the frozen pizzas back to my home and everyone loved it!

High Blood Pressure. Tom had high blood pressure. His doctor told him to cut back on drinking fluids. Tom took the advice and reduced his fluid intake. Tom also made an effort to eat healthier foods. Tom's blood pressure began to drop.
Yoga. I got into the habit of doing yoga at work. I was a little off-center at first. I tried to do side-lying pose. My wrists hurt. I had to stop doing yoga for a week.

The Dog Race. Joe and his dog were playing outside. Joe wanted to show his dog how much he loved. The two dogs got into a fight. They fought so hard that Joe's dog beat him. Joe was so sad that he took his dog outside to play.

New Television. The Johnson family decided to buy a television. The first television they saw was a dvr. They were unsure about it so they read the directions. They were excited to see how it worked. They set it up and were amazed by the results.

Apple Tree. The old apple tree in front of our house is falling down. Our family is getting ready to move. We are trying to find the biggest tree we can. After trying for an hour, we finally found the biggest tree. We started moving the tree tonight.

Slurpee. My son was running around and got frustrated with his water bottle. I said I'm thirsty. He looked at me and said I was thirsty. I gave him a slurpee and he drank it. We went to the park and had a fun day.

Fun Times. The couple went on a cruise. They enjoyed every moment of it. The couple started to get bored. They stopped at a hotel and had some fun games. The couple never wanted to go on another cruise again.

Video Games. Kenny was playing video games one afternoon. He wasn't paying attention to his controller. It slipped from his hands and flew across the room. It landed on his head and he started crying. Kenny's parents grounded him for a month for the incident.

Cartwheel. I was walking with my friends in the forest. We were running across a tall pine tree trunk. We decided to make a cartwheel. My friends all fell and fell. I held on to the ground until I made it up.

Food. My friend is very frugal. He only buys a few items at a time. Today he bought a few packages of chicken nuggets. He said it was too unhealthy to eat. I guess we'll have to see how expensive the chips become.

Race to victory. Mark was an avid motorcycle racer. He wanted to win the next big race at the track. He prepared really hard for the race and even ate breakfast on race day. On the day of the race he was really nervous and even couldn't eat. Luckily though, he won by only a few seconds and was so happy.

Chinese Food. John was eating some Chinese food. It was rather good but he couldn't decide what to order. John ordered two spicy chicken wings. He thought they were spicy and ordered three more. John ate all three wings and loved the flavor.

Orchard. Alfred owned an apple orchard. He sold apples at the market. Alfred's neighbor had an apple tree. The neighbor was hungry so Alfred sold some apples to him. The neighbor was happy and thanked Alfred for his generosity.

Turtle Encounter. Sally was walking home when she came across a turtle. The turtle was swimming across the road. The turtle turned around and ran away. Sally walked to her car to pick the turtle up. The turtle was very cute and her cat took it home.
Fire. My brother lit a fire last night. I put on my clothes, but forgot my lighter. It started small. We ran around the yard yelling. The fire got bigger but we managed to put it out.
New Phone. My niece bought a new cell phone. She dropped it in a puddle. The phone broke. She told me the phone was worth the cost of new clothes. I didn't believe her, so I threw the old phone away.
Animal Instinct. Lenny always wanted to own a cat. One day his friend tells him that she has one. Lenny agrees to buy the cat. He finds the cat unattractive. He decides to let the cat go.
The Celery. I bought some celery from the store. I couldn't even open the bag! I tossed it in the garbage. Later, I decided to eat it anyway. I regret not opening the bag.
Bishop. Bishop was a homeless man. He had a small apartment. He had been homeless for years. A friend moved into his apartment one day. Bishop now has a new best friend.

Jimmy Races. Jimmy's dad always beat him at pool every weekend. Jimmy challenged his dad to a race. Jimmy got all his dad's pool paddles ready and practiced. He raced his dad. Jimmy's dad beat him in the race.

Playing in a Band. The local jazz band decided to practice for their gig in a nearby park. The band practiced all day, and night. They were all nervous that they might not play well. The day of the gig they did their best. They performed well and received a standing ovation.
Spaghetti. I made a spaghetti for my friend. He was very impressed with how good it was. I gave him the recipe. He told me that he liked the sauce. I made the sauce again.

Coming Out. Logan was very nervous. He had just turned 18 and wanted to wear his new jeans to school. But he was scared nobody would like them! His mom made him wear them anyway. Logan was relieved that no one seemed to care.

Dylan's new car. Dylan is very happy with his new car. He loves the fact that it has safety features. However, he is upset that he cannot drive it down the street. One day, he drives it down the street and it slips off the curb. Dylan is upset that he cannot drive his new car.

New App Department. Lance was a new employee in the software department. His job was to build new tools for the company. He was not very good at this so he needed help. He asked some of his coworkers for help. They all came up with a list of tools for Lance and they were happy.

Bob and the Donkey. Bob went to the store to buy some new socks. He bought a new pair of socks with a cute cow on the front. The next day, Bob wore the cow socks to school. A boy told him that he didn't like cow socks. Bob bought another pair of socks with another animal on the front.

Tail rider. Dana was in line for a lottery ticket. He had his fingers crossed as he was looking for his numbers. But then a strong gust of wind whipped the ticket and it flew. Dana shrieked and he grabbed the ticket and ran. Dana never found his number and his winnings were refunded.
Lost charge. Susie had a charge on her phone. It wouldn't work. She was getting mad. Susie had to go to the store. Then they helped her charge it.

Becca's Christmas Kitten. Becca was planning to have her new kitten for Christmas. She was excited for it to be released. But when the kitten came, the kitten was severely injured. Becca was sad, but decided to get another kitten. Becca now has a new kitten that she loves.

Science Dissection. The scientist was dissecting a frog. He used a strong force to pierce the frog's nervous system. Then, he used a small force to remove the frog's spinal cord. The frog died. The scientist was very sad.
A Hot Day. It was one of the hottest days in the entire summer. Tom wanted to get inside to play. It was really hot outside. Unfortunately the heat didn't last long. Tom never went outside again.

Robot Fighting. Tom was taking a science class. He was discussing robots and their fighting potential. He said that they could be used for good or bad. The professor told Tom that was a terrible way to start. Tom tried harder, but didn't learn much.

Knitting. Abby wanted to learn how to knit. She started off with simple designs. Then she added beads and even fabric. After a long time of practice she was a great knitter. Abby was so happy that she had learned how to knit!

Large water slide. My friends and I were looking forward to going to the water park. We decided to go for the large water slide. We got our friend to drive us down the slide and we began to slide. We then realized that we didn't have water. We drove back to the car to refill our water.

Cat eats the Dog Treats. Bobby and his cat were playing together. The cat decided he was hungry. He tried eating the dog treats in front of Bobby. Bobby didn't notice that his cat was eating them. The cat had to stop chewing the treats.

Jane and Cat. Jane lived next to a stray cat named Cat. She took Cat home one day when she saw something in the kitchen. The cat was dead. Jane realized the cat had been killed by a snake. She brought the cat home and buried the snake.

Surfing Scare. Tod's parents took him to the beach. He didn't like it and wanted to go home. He was too scared to do it. His mother put him on the surfboard and let him go. Tod never wanted to do it again.

Girl Friend. Sally was a little girl who had always been shy. Her older sister asked her what she wanted for Christmas. Sally told her mom what she wanted and her mom sent a gift. When she got home, Sally's mother was very happy. Sally hugged her mom very tightly and said thank you mom.

Chatty Kathy. Kathy likes to gossip. Kathy makes very bad decisions and is not honest. One day a coworker confronted Kathy. She asked Kathy why she lied about her boyfriend. Kathy said she didn't want to hurt her boyfriend's feelings.

Scuffed. Sara bought a scratch-off ticket from the scratch-off machine. She scratched it off to see who would pay the $50. The machine had no money left! Sara quickly grabbed her keys and money from her purse. She left the scratch-off ticket on the floor for someone else to pay.

Slow Internet. John was trying to watch a movie. All of a sudden his internet slowed down. He realized he couldn't watch the movie. John called a company he had heard of. The company sent someone over to fix his internet.

Baseball Slide. We always had fun playing baseball in the park. One day I decided to make it a tradition. I grabbed the glove and threw it to the neighbor's window. As he opened it he let out a huge grin. That's when I realized I had my glove stuck inside the frame.

Lester Jumps Rope. Lester wants to lose weight. He decides to start jumping rope. He jumps rope for an hour every day. Lester notices a slight weight loss. Lester is happy that he has started jumping rope.

Peanut. My friend's wife made a sandwich. Her son took a bite of the sandwich. He was allergic to peanuts. My friend said he should have asked for help to avoid it. I think he's still allergic to peanuts.

Water Skiing. I took my son to the water ski slope the other day. It was the best water ski I have ever ridden. I have never skied before. My son was nervous because he has never been on a water ski before. The water felt amazing.
Angkor Wat. My friend and I drove to Angkor Wat. We saw some statues and temple ruins. Then we went on a tour. We learned about the history of Angkor Wat. It was one of the best days of my life.

Worse Than Before. The teacher said that she had read every book. Gina was disappointed and wanted to leave. The teacher told her to be patient. Gina stayed to watch the movie. The rest of the day went by as normal.

Horatio Finds a Job. Horatio has been out of work for three weeks. He has applied for many jobs, but no one has called him back. One day, he hears back from a job fair. Horatio applies for a job as a bartender at the fair. Horatio is happy that he finally found work.
The Cookie Burn. Molly was baking cookies for her mom. She poured in the batter. She forgot to add sugar. Molly burned the cookies. Molly cried until her mom washed off the burn.

Construction Workers. Sandy works for a construction company. He often works in dangerous areas. Recently Sandy got injured while working. Sandy was out for surgery. Sandy is now more cautious while working.
Borrowed Money. Ned borrowed some money from his aunt. He forgot he had the money. When he remembered he had it he took it back. He told his aunt. They argued and then Ned had to pay for the money.

Scuba Diving. Kia went scuba diving for the first time. She was scared at first. But soon she got used to the water and got over her fear. Kia was happy she had done something different. She was thrilled she could finally enjoy scuba diving.

Preacher. When I was little, I was taught to hate Preacher the parrot. I was very rude to him and made his life hard. He would throw his food out of the window and scream. My mom came to try and save him, but she didn't understand him. Finally, she decided to simply hit him.

The evil dad. Mick always had a plan to take his wife's money. He bought a truck with lots of guns and then he had it repainted. When he went out to drive it, there was an armed gang. He tried to avoid them, but to no avail. They beat him up and Mick realized he had to stop his plans.

sad news. Izzy was depressed. She was reading a book when her cat jumped up and knocked it over. Izzy began to cry. A friend came to comfort her. Izzy's friend was nice enough to help her see things differently.
College. I am an undergraduate student. I am very bored with my life. I decided to write a book on college life. I wrote a book on college life. I am now working on a sequel.

Punishment. I was playing baseball outside. I was trying to hit a fly ball with my bat. I threw the ball but it rolled down the street. A car came by and I tried to run away. I was promptly hit with a baseball bat.
Skip almost drowns. Skip was swimming in the ocean with his friends. Skip was having a great time. Skip suddenly felt a tap on his leg. He tried to paddle but it was too late. Skip nearly drowned.
Dog. Our neighbors have a dog. They let the dog outside to pee. Our dog knocked over their garbage can. The dog got sick. We called animal control and they came and took the dog away.

A big hike. I always take a hiking trip when I go to the mountains. This trip took longer than expected so I decided to slow it down. I got comfortable in my tent and laid down in my sleeping bag. I was having trouble getting comfortable and had to use the bathroom. After using the bathroom I realized it wasn't much longer before hiking again.

Ice Cream Day. Today was the first day of the school year. It was a day for ice cream and all the students had fun. The first place prize was a big chocolate cone. When it was over, they all went home. After dinner, they all told each other to come back tomorrow.
I love her too. I love her so much. She is my girlfriend. She is my only girlfriend. I don't think that I'm ever going to give up on her. I'm going to work hard everyday to make her happy.
Jeff goes to the lake. Jeff is swimming. He notices he has to go to the lake. He gets to the lake. He gets a great tan. He goes home happy with his tan.

The Saturation Point of Swiss Cheese. Devin bought some Swiss cheese at the grocery store. He got the cheese home and took it out to the sink. Devin began to measure Swiss cheese in bottles. Then, he put the bottles into his refrigerator. After two weeks, he was able to taste Swiss cheese.

Easier Sanctimonious Than Done. Derek decided to do something about his water bill. First he filled the jug with tap water. Then he turned on the faucet and filled the jug with water. It took him two hours to fill the jug. Derek still felt he didn't clean the whole house.
Tara's Hat. Tara had a beautiful hat. She decided she wanted to sell it. She had a hat rack set up at her office. Everyone loved her hat. Tara made a lot of money selling her hats.

Recycled Cans. Jill took a can to the recycling center to be sorted. She took the cans out of the can and dropped them. The cans split and broke apart. Jill decided she did not like the smell of the broken cans. She decided to avoid taking them to recycle.

Cake. I made a cake for a family function. I wasn't supposed to be making cakes. My cake looked good but tasted terrible. I had to send the cake back to the store for a refund. I made a cake for my son's birthday.

Jake Falls Off Ladder. Jake is playing basketball with his friends. He is trying to dunk the ball. He falls to the bottom of the basketball. He gets up but it hurts his ankle. Jake decides he better try again.
Slide. I went out to a slide. It was covered in ice. I was stuck. I slid down the slide. Then I had to get up and walk the rest of the way.
Grocery Games. One time my mom let me pick out my own groceries. She said I had to do it alone. It was a lot of fun. I won tons of toys, too! Then she bought us all ice cream cones as a reward!
Track and Field Star. Josie loved to run track. She practiced all summer long. At the age of 16, she tried out for the team. She made the team! She was so excited!

Officer Helps. Jodie was in trouble. She was going to be in a lot of trouble. A police officer came to help. He wrote Jodie up for truancy. Jodie was so excited when the police officer gave her a ticket.

Sharing. Shelly and her mom had just moved to a new state. They did not have anything in common at first. Then they started talking. Soon they were best friends! They decided to plan a trip for next summer to see the mountains.
wallet. Ben had a wallet. He thought he was going to use it today. He got home and it was missing. He searched all over the house. Finally, he found it in the fridge.

Roller Coaster. Tiffany really wanted to go on the big roller coaster. She looked up the rides at the park. She decided to get on the Superman roller coaster. She screamed the whole time. Tiffany was glad that she did not go on the Superman roller coaster.

The water on the books. Rene was playing with her mom's water bottle. They were swimming together. The water went under the counter. Rene's mom found out and scolded her. The mom made them clean it out the next day.

Christmas Shopping. Rene is looking to buy a Christmas gift for her parents. She begins to browse the market for a Christmas gift. After an hour of looking she returns home to their gifts. Her parents thank her and take her out to dinner. She is happy to be shopping for her gifts for Christmas.

Dave goes fishing. Dave always wanted to go fishing. One day he and his friends went fishing. They put on their gear and headed out to the lake. As they got there, Dave fell and broke his leg. Dave never wants to go fishing again.

Rick's Poor Time Management. Rick never bothered to study for his final exam. He never turned in his assignments at the deadlines. His teacher gave him no options but to ask the professor for help. He was finally able to turn in his exams at the last minute. The professor never received any grades for his poor student work.

Faker. I wanted to see my favorite actress in person. I walked up to her at a restaurant and asked for her autograph. She told me she never saw me before and that we would never meet. We went our separate ways, and went our separate ways. The rest of the day, I went and saw my friend at the park.

Cookies. Hannah made cookies for her family. She put the batter in the toaster. While she was distracted, her cat knocked over the toaster. The cookies burned on the bottom of the toaster. The family couldn't eat the cookies since they were ruined.
Stage. The baby boy went to the bar. He started crying. The baby's mom came to see. She had a little baby sitter. The baby kept crying.

Great American Story. Hank is a fan of the Great American Story. He loves hearing the cowboy say his famous catch phrase. When a show airs, he tries to memorize the entire script. Hank's wife gives him her autograph on the way home from the show. Hank is happy to have found a way to make his Great American Story experience special.

Soapmaking Disaster. I tried to make soap last week. Unfortunately, I forgot to add the essential oils. I tried to stir the ingredients together but that did not work. I finally made soap and poured it into a container. Unfortunately, my roommate told me that it was soap and not soap.

Bacteria. Tim noticed a strange color in his mouth. He then took a toothbrush and washed his teeth. A lot of bacteria was released into the air. Tim then noticed it in the toilet. He had to clean it out with a cloth.

Eyebrow pulling. My sister in law has always pulled her eyebrows. Her eyebrows were very long and pronounced. One day her eyebrows got very tight. She had to get her eyebrow waxed. The wax pulled all the hairs off her eyebrow and they were smooth.
New Bag. Nita found a new bag. She was excited to use it. She put it on the shelf and took a break. When she went to retrieve it, it had ripped! She had to get a new one, but that wasn't so bad.

The Dog. Mary always felt bad when she was around animals. She would always pick up the smallest and scrawniest ones. One day she saw a little puppy playing on the side of the road. She decided to take it home and make it her pet. She named her new dog Spot.

Choose. Anna didn't like chocolate. But her parents told her that she had to choose between them. She was forced to decide between chocolate and candy. Anna didn't like the candy but she was forced to eat the chocolate. She decided to eat the candy and was no longer forced to choose.
Ridiculing. Tim was walking home. He felt very rude. He got into a fight with someone. Tim never apologized for his rudeness again. He never felt good enough about himself.

Low Carbs. Bill and Mary decided to eat healthier. They went to the market and bought fruits and vegetables. They cooked them in the crockpot. The family ate the food that night. They felt satisfied with the food they purchased.

Ice Cream Truck. Kane wanted to buy a treat from the ice cream truck. The truck stopped for customers at the end of the day. She could see her friends looking at the truck, too. She decided she would buy a few flavors. She happily ate ice cream with her friends that night.

Snow Cone Surprise. Dana loved snow cones. However she had never seen one up close before. When she took one to her friend's house, she was amazed. The cone was very large, and incredibly perfect. Dana's snow cone was nothing short of amazing.

First day of Seventh grade. Today is my seventh day of Seventh grade. I've been so nervous to get up today, I've been crying. I have such a hard time getting up at the sound of my alarm clock. It doesn't matter because today is the day of school. I'm not having any more of these fears.

Expired plan. Rory was trying to shop at a mall. She wanted to buy a new watch for her new cell phone. But she noticed that her card was expired. She called the bank to see if they could get her a new one. Luckily, they were able to.
A Milk-Tooth. Lucy's daddy had gotten her a milkshake. He had gotten it at the store. Lucy ran back home with the milk-cream. She licked the milk off of her fingers. It was disgusting!

Mantis. When I was a kid, my aunt bought me a mantis. It was red and was very long. It would bend in strange ways and then twitch a lot. I would watch it twitch and laugh to myself. I never knew it could feel pain.

Mother knows best. Dana was a good looking woman who didn't take no for an answer. When her son needed a pair of jeans, Dana didn't have any left. She had to go to the store to buy a pair. She bought some and hurried home to wear them. She loved her new jeans and was glad to have them for once.
The Eyebrow Burn. Tara was at a party. She was drinking a soda and chewing on something. Her eyebrows started to hurt. They became really red. She had to take them out before anyone could see them.
Scared. Tom was taking a long road trip. He wasn't used to driving so fast. He was pulled over by a cop. Tom was scared of the cop. He tried to get out of the car quickly.

The Kitten. Anna's kitten escaped one day from his house. He was frantic and scared, and Anna called a friend. The kitten's owner picked him up and brought him home. Anna brought him home and he was happy! Anna's kitten came home to Anna!

Gloves. Jenny needed a pair of gloves. She went to the sporting goods store. Jenny looked at many different pairs of gloves. Finally, Jenny decided on the perfect pair of gloves. Jenny purchased her new gloves from the sporting goods store.

The Bonus. John was on a project at work. He was working on the computers. He was talking to a co-worker. John called him up to give him a special bonus. John handed him his check and they both went for sushi.
Tired. I was so tired. I slept late into the night. I had to wake up early the next morning. I went to my test in a drowsy haze. I failed the test because I was tired all night.

Group Activity. Rita and I went to the beach. We walked on the beach for an hour. We sat on the sand and talked about life. We played board games and ate sandwiches. We both had a fun time at the beach.

Need a Job. John was a great student, but he wasn't very ambitious. He wasn't sure if he would become a doctor or lawyer. He went to a job fair and got a call from a recruiter. He was hired at the recruiter's location! John felt proud and happy.

Study Up. Dennis' dad was upset that his son was getting bullied in school. He told him to study up, and he began studying hard. By the time he was 16, he was so smart and well prepared for school. His dad was proud of Dennis' hard work. He also gave him a toy to reward his hard work.

The camp pen pal. The girls went on a camping trip. One of the girls noticed an old girl camping nearby. They decided to write her a letter. The girl was so touched she wrote them back right away. The girls became friends and wrote many letters with her.

Jane's nail party. Jane's nails had been a problem for months. She decided to get them professionally done. After a few weeks she decided to have a nail party. There were plenty of nail polish nails on the table. Everyone loved their new nails.

New Music. Ben and his friends went to a club. A song that they liked started playing. Ben and his friends tried to follow the song. Eventually, they discovered a cover of the song. The cover version ended up being better than the original.
Sam's Sail. Sam was sailing down the river. He decided to tie his sail to the bottom of the boat. Sam felt a strong current. He fell out of his boat and into the river. He swam to shore safely.

The Casino. The family went to a casino. They tried to play slots, but lost all their money. Then they went back home to restock their pantry. They went to bed happy that they won the rest of their money. The next day, they found out that the jackpot had doubled to $5 million!
Construction. Timothy needed a new computer. He was too poor. Timothy decided to build his own. His computer was successful. Timothy used it for a long time.

The Little Pig. Sally found a baby pig on the side of the road. She decided to take it home with her. She put it in a plastic piggy bank. She fed it milk and cared for him for a few weeks. When it grew up, it was big enough to take to the wild.

Thief. The man tried to steal a bag from the grocery store. The police saw him and began to question him. The man pulled a knife and threatened the officer. The police shot and killed the man. The store manager fired a warning shot.
The Garage. The woman went out to her garage. She found some things she didn't want. She cleaned out her garage. She kept her husband company while she did it. She went inside to tell her husband.
Total scare. I took my dog for a long walk. He was not used to the longer walk. The path was a little muddy. After the walk we went home. He was scared all over the house.

Oogum Boogum. Gabe was very annoyed by the loud noise coming from his car. His neighbor told him to change the stereo system. Gabe refused, since he didn't want to do anything. A week later his neighbor knocked on his door. He had finally fixed the problem, he said.
