Last Letter. Amy decided to send her father's last will and testament. She had to keep a secret. She tried to find out his secret. She found it in the papers. Amy sent his last will and testament in secret.
Smash. Tim was working at an office. The boss called him into his office. He told Tim that his boss wanted him to quit his job. Tim quit his job. Tim decided that quitting was never the answer.

Moving Out of State. Mason was unhappy about moving to a new city. He didn't want to take any risks so he stayed in. As he was moving to his new place he kept sneezing and coughing. The stress began to really affect his health. He decided to move back home so he wouldn't be so stressed.
Torn Shorts. Sam had just bought a new pair of shorts. He wore them to a party. All of a sudden the shorts ripped. Sam could not repair them. He decided to wear jeans instead.
Tony Grills a Fish. Tony is very hungry. Tony wants to eat something delicious. Tony decides to grill a salmon. Tony grills a salmon. Tony is very satisfied with his grilled salmon.
Sam has a fall. Sam is at the playground. Sam plays on the swings and falls down. He hits his head hard. Sam falls to the ground and gets a concussion. Sam heads home and calls for an ambulance.
Alarm. The alarm went off at 10 am. I got up and walked to the refrigerator. I grabbed a cup of coffee. I went back to bed. I heard the alarm go off again at 3 pm.

Food Poisoning. Tom was at an Italian restaurant. He ordered the same food they served to him. Later that night he developed stomach aches. Tom realized he had food poisoning. Tom went home to rest and recover.
Bowling Champion. The kids lined up for the game. They were ready to go. They all stood and bowled. It was their first bowling tournament. They won and got a trophy.

Quiz. Bill had an IQ score of 130. He thought his score was good enough to get a high IQ tutor. The tutor gave him practice problems to practice on. Eventually Bill got his high IQ tutor job. He still doesn't have his high IQ.

Check Again. When Tom went to the bank, he checked his account again. He was surprised that everything was still in order. He was happy he had done this before. He went into his bank and spoke with a supervisor. They gave him an error message and told him to do it again.

The Cubbies. Tim and John decided to build a cubby in their basement. They went to the hardware store to get the supplies. The cubby didn't look very sturdy. They decided to use nails instead. They finished the cubby and put a lock on it.

Good enough. Sam was at the car dealership looking to buy a used car. He wasn't sure he liked the look of the one he wanted. He decided to test drive it out with his friends. It was a great car and he couldn't pass up a chance to buy it. It would take him a while to really decide if he liked it enough.

Laundry Cash. Jana needed money to pay bills. She decided to launder her laundry. She took her dirty laundry and threw it into the laundromat. The laundry was never laundered and she was charged thousands. Jana swore off money laundry forever.

Piano lessons. Julia had trouble playing the piano. So her mom took her to a music teacher. At first she was struggling. She even missed a few notes. But soon, Julia was playing her piano like an expert.

Hair Loss. Cory had always loved his long hair. But one day he grew tired of his long hair. He began to grow it out and put it in a bun. After many months, he was unable to pull his hair out. He was devastated by his loss of his hair.
The Fair. Ike went to the fair. He saw all the animals. He even saw a lion eat a pig. He was so happy! He was glad he went to the fair.

Out of Deodorant. Dan was walking to work. He smelled a foul odor coming from his pantyhose. He tried to quickly put them on but they were too tight. Dan had to pull them off to inspect them. The pantyhose had a rip in the seam and Dan had to throw them away.
Lost and Found. My parents bought me a new book. The book was very nice. I walked down to the local library to look for it. I ran into the lady who read it to me. I picked it up and walked home.

Uncertain about Lecture. Bill was very nervous for his first lecture. He did not want to say anything but was still scared. He was not sure what to say, he just sat there staring. His professor told him to relax, he had a good one. After he relaxed, Bill felt much better and knew he had done well.
Running in a race. Tom wanted to win the race. He wanted to do well. He decided to practice. Eventually he improved enough. He ran in the race.

Riding a Bike. Joey and Tom had been friends since he was a child. They rode their bikes to school and back often. One day Joey fell off his bike and broke his leg. Tom stopped to help him fix it and they both became friends again. The bike riding helped them both bond and they made a great team.

Weight Sadness. My son came home last night from a vacation with his family. He is a little sad as he has lost 40 pounds already. He was sad when his mom brought home a few boxes of his old clothes. His mom reminded him they will be back in a few days. I hope they return to him in a few days.

Norma Cleans the Fish Tank. Norma decided that she needed to clean her fish tank. She went to the store to purchase cleaning supplies. Norma cleaned the fish tank. Norma went home and put the cleaned fish back in the fish tank. Norma was glad that her fish was no longer dirty.

Manicurist. Tom bought an old house to rehabilitate. He hired a company to redo the house. They replaced all of the old appliances. Then, they painted the house a new color. After Tom was done, the house was beautiful!
Smoky Barbecuing. Tom loved barbecuing. He bought a grill. He used it often. He got sick. Tom stopped barbecuing for good.
Exam. The man took an exam. He studied for a while. He felt confident about the exam. When the test was over, he felt nervous. He passed the exam.

The Windy Day. The weather man had predicted bad weather the day before. Happily, I made plans with my brother to visit the nearby farm. The weather man predicted that the wind would pick up in the afternoon. I packed my bags, and we made our way to the farm. The farmer was excited to see me and said we had a lot to learn.

The Lightning. One day I was taking a walk through the park. All of a sudden it started raining very hard. The sky darkened and lightning flashed. I was so scared that I ran home. I was so scared that I couldn't go to sleep that night.

Building a House. My dad and I wanted a house. We went to the home improvement store to buy the materials. After I got home, I gathered all the materials to make a house. When I was done, I brought the finished house to my dad. We had a nice house for our future family.

She Understands. I am really bad at remembering simple facts. I remember most of the facts from my past life. One day, my friend told me that she knew more facts than I did. She told me that my life was full of facts that I didn't remember. I was angry at her and tried to do better in my future life.

Too Drunk. Tom was drunk at a party. He was really clumsy and wound up getting into a fight. He couldn't control his temper and his friends were scared. They decided to go home early instead. Tom was more careful at home and didn't get into any trouble.

Molly. Molly was my pet hamster. One day, she got loose from her cage. She ran off into the night and I chased her. I caught her in the yard and took her back home. The next morning, Molly was back with a new hamster.

Bear. Karen went camping with her family. She decided to stay in a large tree house. As she was sleeping she heard a loud noise. Karen thought the noise was bear claws. She jumped out of bed, frightened.
Cold Morning. I was tired. So I got out of bed. I walked to the coffee shop. The coffee shop was closed. So I had to go to a coffee shop for my coffee.

Cat Poop. Cameron woke up one morning. He noticed that his cat had pooped all over the house. He looked around for his cat, but could not find him. He looked in the bathroom, and noticed that the toilet was open. Cameron was relieved that he was able to flush the toilet without waking his cat.

Mark Cooks Dinner. Mark's favorite food was Chinese food. One day he decided to cook his own Chinese food. He purchased all the ingredients and followed a recipe. He cooked some delicious chicken for his family. They all thought he made their food and they were impressed.

A Fun Trip. Bill and Jim rode their bicycles through the park. They saw all kinds of birds and squirrels. They rode their bicycles through the park all afternoon. They enjoyed their time in the park. When it was time to leave, they went to the hotel.

Johnny Runs a Marathon. Johnny has always wanted to run a marathon. He trains for several months in preparation. Johnny runs in the gym for many months. Finally he runs a marathon. Johnny is happy to have finally completed his goal.

The Sore Loser. John went to the casino to play some slots. He put all of his money into one slot machine. John lost all of his money in one shot. He tried to convince his friend to go back and help him. His friend politely declined and went to his car anyway.
The Cookies. Sandra decided to bake some cookies. She put them in the oven. She took out the eggs, butter and sugar. Then, she mixed it up. She couldn't wait to taste them!

Helping Out. Dan's dad had been sick and wasn't going to get better. Dan decided he would help out at his dad's house. He cooked a big meal and made some snacks. He also brought his dad some medicine. Dan was happy to do something nice for his dad.

Baseball Throw. I decided to start throwing the baseball to myself in the outfield. I watched some baseball games while throwing a baseball. I kept watching the games until I was throwing to myself. I tried to get better at throwing the baseball. In the end, I became a great baseball thrower.

Hard Work Pays Off for Alexis. Alexis loved going to work. Her favorite thing was the big performance review held every Tuesday. Alexis worked harder than she ever had before. On Wednesday, she made her managers proud by being the highest performer. She thanked them all with a big smile and a big raise.
Broken. She had a hard time getting up. When she awoke she felt awful. The pain was worse on her face. She was crying but she couldn't stop crying. It would take her hours to clean it.
Copy. A man wrote a poem. He wanted to publish it. He wrote it in a college paper. But he didn't get it published. He had to hire someone to copy it.

Martini. Tom went to a fancy martini bar with friends. He had an idea of what to drink. He didn't tell anyone he had it prepared. When he got home and saw the label he was shocked. He couldn't believe he had drank a martini with acid!

Swept by the wind. My wife was walking to the store with her toddler. He started running to play but started playing fast. He pushed me up by my hands. My wife ran to stop him and he pushed her back. We ended up with a small scratch on our hands.

Fred Collects Stamps. Fred has wanted to learn how to stamp his name. He visits his local post office and buys stamps. Eventually Fred learns how to stamp his name. Fred is proud of his accomplishment. He is glad to have learned to stamp his name.

Canned Peas. Sally loves canned peas. Her family used to cook all of their meals. She didn't like the thought of having to throw them out. Her family decided to buy her some canned pea soup. Now Sally can eat peas whenever she wants.

The Bad Sitter. Samantha was at the movies. She was having a horrible time getting her popcorn. Her mother kept telling her she would come and get it for her. The woman never showed up. Samantha had to call her a bad sitter.
The Wet Paws. Sam was at his friend's house. They were having a party. His friends threw water on his paws. He was grossed out. But he didn't cry.

Clowns. I wanted to become a clown. I got a degree in clown psychology. I took a job at the local circus. There was a talent show coming up that I had to do. I got hired to do a clown for the talent show!

Pie Eating Contest. Kim challenged the neighborhood girl to a pie eating contest. She had never won a contest before. She decided to study very hard. When the time came, she was very nervous. Luckily, she won and received a great prize.
A good fit. Cindy bought a new suit. It fit her a little tight. She went shopping for more fitting suits. She had trouble finding any. She eventually just bought a regular fitted one.

Running into old friends. It was time to see my old friends from college. I had forgotten where I was going. As soon as I walked in the door, I ran into them. They were so nice. I didn't even want to talk to them.

Red Sorghum. I went to the market with my daughter. She had found a very large red sorghum. She thought it looked exotic and strange. We bought it. When we went home, we thought it was very exotic and strange.

Don't Give Up. Alfred had been training for the Olympics for a year now. He thought that it was finally time to compete. His coach was worried that he might not do well. In the first few games, Alfred could only dribble the basketball. He still ended up doing very well and getting an A.
beach. Dan went to the beach. There were a lot of people at the beach. Dan got stung by a jellyfish. Dan had to be treated by a lifeguard. Dan left the beach immediately.
Wedding. The man threw the bouquet. The woman noticed it. She stopped by the man's wedding. She offered him the wedding. He accepted it.

The Bus Fight. The bus came out of the stop. A group of people were fighting. One of the people on the bus started to throw a punch. Another group of people took off their jacket and went to check it. The fight began to end.

Time to cook dinner!. Today I am going to make dinner for my family. I am going to make a lasagna with garlic, onion, peppers, and tomatoes. I am going to cook all the ingredients on the stove. After the food is done I will serve it to my family. My family will have a great time tonight with my dinner!

Sarah Flies On An Airplane. Sarah had always wanted to fly a kite. Sarah's parents took her to the airport for her kite lesson. Sarah got her kite ready and headed out. Sarah flew the kite for the first time. Sarah was so excited when she saw the clouds, she had a smile on her face.
New bag. Susie wanted a new bag. But her purse broke. So she did not buy one. She decided to just start carrying her things in her car. She could not be happier.
Cheap sale. Samantha was shopping with her mom. She saw some things that she really wanted. She noticed that the price was only $3. She didn't want to pay for it. However, she ended up buying them.

Sparky. Sparky needed to get something out of his locker. He opened the lock and saw a wallet in there. Sparky went to ask if anyone else wanted it. There was no one but Sparky who needed the wallet. Sparky gave it to him and they both went out together.
Tarts. I had a craving for some chocolate candy. I searched every cupboard in my house. I found some tarts. I ate them anyway. I never wanted to eat any tarts ever again.
Losing religion. I was invited to join a church. I joined the local church. I thought the church was nice. However, I lost my faith. I felt terrible for months afterwards.

The Striker. John was a tough kid in high school. He made fun of kids with glasses. One day, he was playing hockey with some boys. John struck a puck and it went through a girl's glasses. John was so embarrassed he had to change his name to Joe.

Browser. Jenny was on her first trip to the beach. She was surfing in the water. She didn't realize that she couldn't swim. She was thrown out of the water. She learned that day not to surf in the water.

The talk. Amy had a crush on Ray from the moment she saw him. She felt like he knew her crush too. They went out for lunch and she felt like he was talking to her. He then approached her and gave her the whole lunch box. Amy thanked him and Ray.

Mommy's Sick For Now. Cindy's mom is sick and is coughing and sneezing. She has been sick all week long and Cindy doesn't want to miss school. Cindy tries to buy her mom some medicine but it isn't available. Cindy begs her mom to change her mind but she refuses. Cindy is beginning to wonder if she will ever go back to school again.
Wresting. There once was a man who wanted to be a pro wrestler. He spent time training in the gym. He practiced hard. He finally became a professional wrestler. He competed and won.

Julie Gets a Trainer. Julie decided she needed to lose weight. Julie went to the gym every day. Julie began lifting weights. Julie gained 20 pounds in the first month of training. Julie can now bench press 100 pounds.
Arrows. John loved to collect arrowheads. His favorite was a large copper arrowhead. One day, his dad took him to an archery range. John shot many arrows at the targets. He even hit a bullseye arrow!
Carpet. Joe needed a new carpet. He went to the store and bought a few. Afterwards he installed all his furniture. Joe was very happy with the result. He was glad to have a new carpet in his room.

Kids trip to the mall. The kids went to the mall for a trip to the food court. They ate all kinds of goodies. At the end of the day they returned home. When they got home they played in the mud. It was a fun day with all of their friends.

Bad Landlord. Dan lived in an apartment for five years. Dan noticed the landlord was taking an uninvited amount of time to do his work. After 5 years of being without a fixed bathroom, Dan became fed up. He called the landlord, who came to his door to say he would be late. Dan was embarrassed and never talked to the landlord again.

Snacks. Jane didn't have much money, but was hungry. She looked around the house, but couldn't find anything good. She finally found a bag of chips. She ate them with a smile. Afterwards, she felt really happy and full.

Card games. The kids were bored on a Sunday afternoon. They decided to play card games. They decided to take turns taking turns counting the cards. After five games they were all ready for bed. They decided they would play more tomorrow.

Oscar's Onions. Oscar has an old friend named Mike. Oscar wanted to have dinner with Mike. Oscar bought his onions. Oscar brought his onions to Mike's house. Oscar and Mike had dinner together at Oscar's house.
Kick in the Shin. Tim went to the store. He picked up a pack of gum. He blew in a tube of toothpaste. He stuck it in his foot. His foot swelled and bled.

Burnt Pizza. Mike and his friends decided to make pizza. They got all the ingredients together. They put the pizza in the oven. After they pulled the pizza out, it was black. He was shocked and embarrassed by the pizza.

Comedy Show. Linda was invited to appear on her friend's comedy show. The show was to air in three days. Linda was worried because her mom was coming for a visit. Linda decided to postpone the show until her mom was at home. Her mom was so impressed, she let Linda stay home and watch the show!

Beer for Breakfast. Alfredo was really hungry. So he decided to make some beer. Alberto brewed a large pot of black beer. And as he poured some, he accidentally knocked over the milk carton. So Alfredo's black beer was ruined.

Getting fit. Jim was always a little bit of a loner. He didn't fit in well at school. So he decided he would start exercising. After a while, he began to fit in better. Jim was able to fit in with his classmates and make new friends.

Erin and the water bottle. Erin had just been hiking with his family. Suddenly, Erin was pulled over by the police. They wanted to write him a ticket for obstruction. Erin argued that he was not obstructing his path. Erin was given a warning and then released.

Malaysia. I had always wanted to visit Indonesia. I decided to travel there one summer. On my first trip, I met so many nice people. We took many pictures. Finally, after two years, I had my own home in Indonesia.

Thunder. We woke up to thunder the other night. I could barely hear it outside. We were so happy when we heard it. It didn't stop after a few minutes. When we got back inside we were too tired to sleep.

The cool rental. Cara was tired of her apartment so cold. She decided to rent a rental. She saw a cute, cute man in a red suit. Cara flirted with him and decided to ask him to come to her. To her dismay, he said yes.
The Stuck Stroller. Sally bought a new stroller. She was driving it down the sidewalk. It started to snow. Sally pulled the stroller into a ditch. She had to drive it home.

Break Up. Dan and his girlfriend, Jen, didn't get along. Dan decided it was best to break up. Dan and Jen decided to move out. They made a house together in the country. Dan and Jen finally got over their differences and lived happily.
Cabin. We had to rent a cabin in the woods. We bought a pine and cedar cabin. It had a very nice cabin feel. It was so nice that we decided to rent another one. We ended up renting that one too.
Wedding. Beth and Joe wanted to have a wedding. They asked their parents to help them. Their parents agreed to help. They made a great wedding. Their parents were very happy.

Rick's Day at the Waterpark. Rick went to the waterpark with his friends. While there, Rick fell off his skateboard and skinned his knee. The paramedics had to give Rick a tetanus shot to stop the bleeding. Rick returned to the skatepark the next day to play again. Rick and his friends had a great time at the waterpark.

Vacation Time. When we arrived in Hawaii, we booked a tour to the zoo. Once we arrived at the zoo, the kids took turns choosing a zoo animal. It was difficult for me to choose, as each animal looked cute. However, as the day progressed, it became clear which animal I liked. I chose an owl, and everyone agreed that it was the cutest.
Earrings. My wife lost an earring at work. She had to wear it around the office. She didn't want to risk losing it. So she took it off and threw it away. We are happy she did so.
Pills. Mason needed new pills. He didn't have enough money for them. He decided to sell them on the street. Mason was stopped and told to leave. He was able to get his pills free.

Clarence's Project. Clarence was always good at drawing, and especially sketching. His friend Ben, however, was terrible at sketching. Clarence asked Ben to help him draw a picture of a sunset. Ben agreed to help him, and the two worked for two hours. Clarence drew the picture of the sunset and it looked beautiful.

Twin Feud. My sister and I hate each other. We are very competitive and often argue. Today, I threw her a curve ball. She threw it back at me and we both laughed. I realized that I shouldn't have gotten my brother to do that.
We're Gonna Need A Bigger... Gina's family was poor. But she wanted a car. So she begged for one. At her cousins house they had a used Toyota. Gina got to drive one.

Upgrade to first class. Juan had been flying first class for years. But when he got his first job as a stewardess, he changed. First class was the only way he could afford to eat well. So he saved every penny and soon had enough money. He bought himself a nice leather and leather seats in first class.

Learning to swim. My friend asked me to teach him to swim. I was so excited to teach him. We went to the swimming pool and had a lot of fun. However, my friend wanted to go home before we got home. Now I am sitting here watching him swim.
Hyacinth. My friend bought some new hyacinths. I went home and picked them out. I didn't know they were poisonous. I bought some other varieties instead. I didn't like the new hyacinths that much.

No Swim in the Park. Today my dog ran up the playground steps. The whole playground was wet except for the pond. I didn't want him to jump in the pond. I told him not to jump in the pond. He happily swam in the pond.
Pickpocket. The man pocketed a purse. He didn't have much money. A man approached him. He tried to steal the purse. The man held up his pockets and let go.

New Pajamas. Amy was tired of her pajamas being wrinkled and worn. She decided she would buy new ones. She went to the store to get a new pair. Amy found the perfect pair for her. Amy was excited to buy the new pajamas.
Magnet. My son used to collect magnets. His magnet collection was very large. He had a small magnet collection that was kept in a drawer. My son bought him a big magnet collection. I am very happy.

Long-Winded. Bill didn't like to spend time outside at the house. There were many storms going on in his area. He decided to put on his air conditioner anyway. The whole time, he was sweating and could not concentrate. Bill decided to leave the house before his heart sank.

Bar Fight. Tom was drunk at the bar. Someone made a rude comment about his weight. Tom started a fight with another drunk guy. Tom wound up hurting the guy too badly. The bartender kicked Tom out of the bar.

Buying a suit. It was Tina's first wedding. She was worried it would be boring. So she went shopping for a suit. She found a suit that was perfect. She was overjoyed that she didn't have to go through the whole process.

The Dam. The farmer was looking at a dam near his farm. He wanted to build a bigger dam but had trouble with funding. He had one more try and it would be enough. With more money, he would be able to finish the project. He was happy that this was finally over.

Clashing Color. Bobby bought a large pot of corn. He had never made it with red beans before. He began to stir the pot. As Bobby did so he spilled some of the corn on the floor. Bobby cleaned up the corn and finished the pot of beans.

Charity. Tom was always a good friend to people. He always gave a hundred dollar bill to anyone. However Tom could not afford the rent anymore. Tom didn't want to move, so he offered to donate it to charity. Tom felt good about himself for giving his time.

Tooth Fairy. Lucy and her grandmother went to the dentist. Her dentist gave her a root canal. The dentist told Lucy they would have to pay $500 for the procedure. Lucy was shocked. She paid the dentist $100 because she was broke.

Christmas. My niece and her husband went to the mall for Christmas. They did not get any gifts. They did not want to go back to shop. When they got home they thought a mall gift is boring. They went home and watched TV all day.
The Acorn. The family bought an acorn. They wanted something new to eat. The family searched through the woods. They found a beautiful acorn. They took the acorn home to eat it.

Old book. It was Lisa's birthday. She was looking through the house for her favorite book. She found an old edition. It was really ugly but she loved the story. She couldn't wait to return it for the new one.

Kenny loses the girl. Kenny is at a ball game. Kenny is playing one of his favorite players. Kenny gets too close to the ball. He tries to steal the ball from the player. Kenny loses the ball and the girl.

When A Family Visit Isn't. I have a cousin visiting from MA this weekend. She asked me for advice on a family outing. The plan was to go to the ocean and have picnics for the whole day. I told her that I am scared of the water and told her to steer clear. She felt foolish and said she will talk to her husband.

Open relationship. My girlfriend told me she would stop talking to me if I didn't open up. I was pretty depressed because of that. I felt like I would never be happy again. She eventually let me know that she wasn't going to do that. I now have a girlfriend and a boyfriend.

Foggy. Tim woke up to the sound of his car start. He got out and saw it had a bad smell. Tim's wife called and told him his engine was blowing. Tim got his engine checked out by his mechanic. Tim's car ran great after the mechanic gave it a shot.
Free Drinks. Eddie's parents were drunk and didn't drive. So Eddie wanted to have some fun. He and his friends went to the bar and drank. His parents came home. They made him drink some more.

A Man and His Dog. Timothy was walking along the beach. He saw a strange dog trying to find a fish. Timothy helped the dog find the fish and they both played together. They became inseparable and Timothy took him home. They named the dog Frank and they both became best friends.

Disney World. Joe wanted to go on a trip to Disney World. He found a bunch of fun activities he could do. He then thought of a good price he would pay for the trip. Joe made a fair deal on the activities and bought them. Joe went on his trip to Disney World.
Choices. Tom was a single guy. He liked to go to bars a lot. He usually would drink alone. One day a group of women asked to go with him. Tom said no because he was too drunk.

Bob's Business. Bob was a very good businessman. Bob was thinking of starting a restaurant. He took an idea to his friends to help them. They decided to make their own restaurant. Now Bob has a successful restaurant.

The Tiger and the Goat. Two cousins decided to take their lunch break. They went to a local park with a big pond. They started feeding the ducks. Suddenly, a tiger ran by and grabbed the goose. The cousins were very shocked and scared.

Planking. I started doing some heavy lifting on the bench press. My arms were getting really big and I was trying to bench 250 pounds. But it wasn't working, and I couldn't lift more than 250 pounds. So, I decided to do a Planking technique. It worked, and I was able to lift over 300 pounds!

New Place. Tom got a new place in the country. He wasn't sure how to set it up. He called a professional to show him how to do it. After a few calls they helped him put everything together. Tom was happy with his choice to buy a house in the country.
Peas. I decided to make a meal. I bought all the ingredients. I tried to follow the recipe. However, it came out disgusting. I realized I had forgotten the peas.

The Yellow Gauntlets. Lisa was playing outside with her friends. She was wearing a bright yellow gauntlet. She was wearing it because she liked to show it off. When she walked around town, people asked her what the hell color was. She told them it was because she thought she looked very cool.
Doggy Love. A man wanted a dog. He drove to the pet store. He saw some puppies he really liked. The man decided he would buy them. The man picked the puppy he wanted and took him home.

Lobster. Jill wanted to make some seafood. She started cooking a big filet mignon. She then added a large scoop of lobster. She flipped it over so it was golden brown. Jill was glad she hadn't added the butter.
Competition. Bob wanted to improve his fitness. He enrolled in a competition. The competition was a swim race. Bob won the race. He was happy he'd achieved his fitness goal.
The bike tip. I went out riding my bike yesterday. I was having a lot of fun. I stopped to look down to check my tire. I saw a large black stain. I saw a red paint stain.

Dinner plans. Toni and her friends were excited about a new restaurant opening in town. The restaurant had been set up for months and they were eager to try it. They went out the night of the grand opening and started eating. When they got home they were happy to see their plates full. They thanked their friends and they loved their meal.
Unending Sadness. Jenny was really sad. Her best friend had just passed away. Jenny began crying. She would cry until her nose was bleeding. After a few hours Jenny stopped crying.

Errand. Gina needed to use the restroom. There was an old lady who would not let her use the restroom. Gina wasn't in any rush. She asked her friend Mary to take her to the front desk. After going there, Gina was relieved to find the front desk was unlocked.
Rita passes. Rita wants to play tennis. Her mother takes her to the tennis court. They play a few matches. She wins the first match. She decides to try out for the next match.

Brad gets revenge. Brad was walking home from school. He was listening to music with his friends. His friend took his music and played it in his car. Brad began to get angry and yell at his friend. Brad's friend pulled over and took his music.

Brainstorming. Sammy had a great idea for a new toy. He brainstormed about it for a few hours. Then he had the idea for the video game. Sammy's parents told him they were not interested in buying the toy. Sammy was disappointed.
Bored Mike. Mike was feeling bored. He couldn't figure out what to do. Then his best friend Pete told him about facebook. Pete suggested Mike join facebook. Mike did and now he's very happy.

Coming or Going?. I went to the bank to deposit a check. A woman who worked in the teller area spoke to me. I asked her what kind of check to deposit. She told me to deposit a check that was mailed yesterday. I told her that was fine, and she said go ahead.

The Investment. Bill was getting ready for a big investment. He bought stocks to put in his business. Bill had heard a lot about the business. Bill invested and made lots of money. Bill was very proud of his work.

Changing the Sheets. Cindy bought some new bed sheets for her bedroom. When her husband got home, he said they were great. Cindy was disappointed when she could not find her bed sheets. She finally found them when she had to change her sheets for work. When her husband came home he was happy to see his bed sheets.
Free Food. Amy and her friends were hungry one day. They could not decide what to eat. Amy decided to give them free food. They all enjoyed their meal. They were happy to have free food.

Vikings. I was reading a new fantasy novel at the library one day. I had read the beginning, but I couldn't wait for the second. My mom came by and asked if I wanted to play Vikings with her. I didn't think it was a good idea, but I told her I was fascinated. She and I spent the rest of the afternoon playing Viking.

Beth wins the lottery. Beth was at the gas station. She wanted to spend some cash. She decided to buy some lottery tickets. The winning numbers were announced. Beth was one of the lucky ones to win the jackpot.
Ferrets. Marge has a ferret named Nya. She wanted to buy a cat for her apartment. Marge researched ferrets online. She found a cute grey ferret for her. Marge purchased Nya and is loving her.
Honeymoon. My friend was in love. Her boyfriend was unhappy. The boyfriend asked his wife to move out. His wife went to the city. He came back and they lived happily ever after.
Cheerleading. Nora wanted to be a cheerleader. She tried out for the squad. She did not make the team. She practiced very hard to be better next tryout. Nora made the team the second time.

Procrastinator. Tim wanted to get his girlfriend to spend more time with him. Tim decided to schedule more time for himself. Tim scheduled more time with his girlfriend. Tim's girlfriend was happy. Tim and his girlfriend spent more time together.
Wrong Phone. Tom was talking on the phone with a girl. His phone dropped. Tom tried to pick it up. It fell to the ground and shattered. Tom was very embarrassed.

heavy box. Dan went to the furniture store to buy some chairs. At the store he bought a box that was over two hundred pounds. Dan walked the box back to his house. After taking it back to the store he picked out some chairs. Dan brought the chairs back to his house and loved his new furniture.

An Old Sword. My friend's father had an old sword. He liked to use it as a walking stick. One day he was drunk and slipped it in a river. He was swept downstream and died. My friend felt guilty about keeping the sword.
Symphony. Sophie loves music. She wanted to learn a new instrument. She decided to learn the cello. She started practicing very hard. Eventually, she was able to play beautiful music with her cello.

Adopted Friend. Lizzy got the phone call at 7:50 today from a stranger. She didn't answer the call. A week later she got a letter from the woman. She was asking her to adopt a dog. Lizzy read the letter and cried with joy.

Dolores the Therapist. Dolores is a very eccentric therapist. Her clients are mostly crazy people. This crazy client took a few of her clients to their deaths. She got her own private investigator to find the person responsible. Dolores is now a murderer and a murderer's accomplice.

Cheesy madness. My friends and I were watching television. We noticed some really lame stuff on the screen. I asked if we could turn it off. The next day I brought it down to the kitchen floor. My friends and I laughed and watched some tv that night.
Amnesia. Dan didn't want to go to school. He just wanted to sleep. He tossed and turned in his bed. Dan finally drifted off to sleep. He woke up in the morning to his parents screaming for him.

Stuck Paper. Dana was working on an essay for school. She was using her laptop in the library. She was about to check out. All of a sudden her computer stopped working. Dana had to call her teacher for help.

Building a treehouse. My grandpa had a treehouse for us to play in as kids. We decided to build one. We gathered our supplies from the store. When it was time to go in, the treehouse fell apart. We had a lot of fun, but it was a lot of work.

Curtains. Sheila went shopping for new curtains. She bought some nice curtains and went home. The next day she noticed the curtains were torn up. She went back to the store and had the store repair them. Now she looks great in her new curtains.

Typing. My son was bored one day. He decided to play a game on his phone. He started typing sentences he thought sounded interesting. When he typed a sentence he did not realize it had typos. The sentence did not make it past the first sentence.
Bored. Ike walked into his class. Nobody was paying attention to him. He began to walk away. Ike's teacher noticed. He told Ike that he had to go.

Where Eggs Come From. Marge had just learned she was pregnant. She wanted to know the truth about the egg. She went to the store to buy an egg. Marge read the back of the package. She learned she was buying a chicken egg instead.

Big Fire. Tom had an important job interview at a store. On the way to the interview he was stopped by an angry car. The driver yelled at Tom for not giving him his business card. The car's engine had overheated and it had a big fire. Tom was able to get out of the interview but lost money.

Laura Does Homework. Laura has been working very hard on her English paper. She has been doing all of her reading for almost a week. Her teacher has told her to submit the paper no later than tomorrow. Laura has been busy all week, but still doesn't have everything ready. She finally finishes her paper and gets a good grade.
Nursery. My husband and I have two kids. The nursery is all out of storage. We need to buy more. We are considering moving. We will look at locations based on cost and convenience.
Navy. Jim wanted to be in the Navy. He trained hard to prove his ability. He took a lot of advanced classes. He graduated with top honors. After a few years, he was accepted to the Naval Academy.

The Candy Store. Carson was at the candy store with his mother. Carson had a ton of fun looking at the different candies. Finally he spotted a new one he really wanted. His mom bought him the candy. Carson couldn't believe how much fun he had at the candy store.

The Ocean. There was a boy who had a problem. His mom said he had to swim or else he would drown. The boy was scared of drowning so his mom signed him up for classes. The classes were in the ocean and the water was very cold. Finally, the boy learned to swim and was happy!

A Day at the Beach. Amber and her friends were going to the beach for the first time. They had been excited when they packed their bags. When they arrived, they realized how packed it was. They had to find other things to do and still had a lot to do. They decided that it would be best to just relax and not do anything.

Train Trip. Gina and her grandma were going on a train trip. Gina wanted to see the mountains while she was there. When she got on the train she realized she did not have her ticket. Her grandma told her it was okay and offered to give her one. Gina gratefully accepted her grandma's offer.

Unprepared. Tom was a rookie on a basketball team. He had never played a lot of games. His coach got him some minutes in the last game. Unfortunately the team had a bad game that day. Tom wasn't able to make any decent plays.
Quitting smoking. Susie was a big smoker. She had a big problem. So she tried to quit. It didn't work for her. She ended up just going cold turkey.

The Doctor. Ben had a sore throat. He had to see the doctor. Ben was afraid to have the doctor in person. He decided to call the office for an appointment. Ben was relieved when he saw the doctor in person.
Making a garland. Tim wanted to do something. He wanted to make a garland. He found some beads. He tried to make a small garland. Unfortunately the beads fell and he messed it up.

The bad veggies. There was lots of bad stuff in Mike's house. The main issue was his vegetables. He tried to cook them but they were always mushy. He would have to throw out some to make the others taste better. It took a long time, but finally he made the best broccoli casserole.

Mixed Mail. I received a package from Canada. I opened it up and saw a letter. It was addressed to me. It said that they sent me a different package. I thanked them and decided to get the package back.
Fish Tank. Tim was eating out. He wanted to save money. So he went to the pet store. There were some fish tanks that looked nice. He bought them and saved money.

The Gem Stick. Jill bought some very pretty emeralds at the store. She hoped they would last her for a lifetime. She didn't expect the gem sticks to last so long. They turned out to be very brittle. Jill decided to just take them back to the store.

Sunny's Pooch. Pooch the cat was always sunny. Pooch loved to run in the rain. One day while running he found his way soaked. Pooch went back home soaking wet. Pooch had a wonderful time playing with his owner.

Salesman. I had a long day at work yesterday and needed some time. I called my friend Steve and asked him to come over. Steve called and said yes and drove me there. Steve came over and we worked all day and drank. Now Steve is back at work and I can't wait to have another day at work.

Headed to the movies. John bought tickets to a movie. He got his wallet out and bought some popcorn. John was so hungry that he began eating. He got so much popcorn that he could barely hold it. He ran back to the ticket booth and bought another ticket.

Steve Visits The Aquarium. Steve has always wanted to visit the aquarium. He decides to save up money so he can visit the aquarium. Steve saves up the money he earns by working at the aquarium. Finally he can afford to visit the aquarium. Steve is happy that he had a great day at the aquarium.

Lopsided House. A house in the neighborhood was being demolished. It was too large for its lot. It was going to be cut into three separate houses. The homeowner got the land to be split in two. They made the house very smaller so it could fit in each house.

Randy and his Grandfather. Randy was visiting his grandfather in the nursing home. His grandfather was very frail. Randy saw his grandfather lying on the floor. He picked him up and carried him to the car. His grandfather was very thankful for his hand.
Sore throat. Sam was out with friends. He had a bad cold. He felt itchy all over his face and neck. Sam stayed home from school for a week. It cleared up after he got better.

Low Patience. The woman ordered a salad. The waiter brought the salad to the table. When the server came back, there was no salad on the table. The woman complained. The server brought her a new salad.

The Pets. It was the first day of summer and Anna had lots of friends. They bought a bunch of new pets that day. They were all excited to have a family. They all played and sang for the first time in months. The summer was fun and so were their pets.

Misha's Mirrors. Misha really wanted to become a better person. She bought mirrors from the local hardware store. She painted them all very pretty. She put her mirrors in her living room. Misha felt very good about her new appearance.
What to Choose. I had a craving for macaroni and cheese. I went to the store to get some. I also got a frozen pizza for lunch. Both were good. I decided to split them.

Basketball Match. Sue had just entered a local basketball tournament. Her team was up against a rival team. She was confident she would win but she was not sure. Sue played well and scored ten points. Her team ended up winning the game.

Swarming with Flies. There were lots of flies in Bob's kitchen. So he decided to make a special snack out of sugar. He started to pour sugar in a glass of water. But then he noticed all the flies flying around. Bob felt angry and frustrated.

Walking and Talking. One day I was walking on the sidewalk and talking to myself. I felt so proud that I didn't have to think. A lady stopped me on the sidewalk and complimented my smile. I thanked her and continued walking. She complimented my walk because I had walked so long that day.

Karen's Misfortune. Karen decided to try an ice cream cone. She was excited for the ice cream to cool off. But the ice cream cone fell and went down the drain. Karen looked at the package and gasped. The ice cream had melted and her cone was dirty.

Game. Lara decided to be a vegetarian. She had heard that meat-free diets were healthy. Lara began to feel sick. She went to the doctor for help. The doctor told her to only eat fish and vegetables again.
Movie poster. I collect movie posters. I have hundreds of posters. They are unique. I collect movie poster collections. I am a collector.
Doored. Jane was a nurse. She was running in the hallway at work. The elevator started to move. Jane started to hear a noise. A stranger had been in the elevator with her.

Starry Night. It was an extremely clear night. The sky was blue with patches of grey and black. Gina hadn't realized it had rained all day. Her mom and siblings were asleep in the living room. They awoke with a bright red sunrise.

Andy Learns to Drive. Andy loved to drive his pickup truck, but couldn't afford to buy one. Andy decided to start to earn extra money by mowing lawns. In addition, Andy decided to start selling his finished lawns. Andy began to earn enough money from his lawn work to buy a car. Andy was so happy when he could finally afford a car!

Dirty House. Jake's family hated washing the dishes. He decided he would get a few. He went to the store and bought all the ingredients. Jake brought the dirty dishes home. His family didn't even notice his dishes were there.

Little Rascal. Tina wanted to play with her little cousin Rascal. Rascal jumped right into Tina's lap. Tina screamed when she heard Rascal. Tina's mom yelled at her to stop playing. Tina promised to be more responsible from now on.

Jerry goes to camp. Jerry was having a bad time in high school. He didn't think his attitude would ever improve. Jerry got a great idea to make himself feel better. He decided to go to summer camp. Jerry made lots of friends there and improved his attitude.
Home plate. I was watching the home plate final. There was two runners on base. Both runners were very close. One runner got a hit on his second swing. We won the game on this wild pitch.

Broken Copier. Tom was trying to make copies at his office. He got into a big fight with a coworker over a copier. His coworker thought Tom was being too hard on him. Tom tried to apologize to his coworker. Unfortunately that didn't make his coworker feel better.

Lost. When I was a kid, I rode my bicycle to work. One day I rode my bicycle in the middle of a storm and lost control. My bicycle fell off of a bridge, and I fell into a river. I did not see a paddle after that day. Now I am afraid of falling off of bridges.
The Cat. John has always loved cats. He decided to adopt one. His cat was very affectionate. John was very pleased with his new pet. John took the cat home and loved him very much.

Volleyball game. Timmy had a volleyball match against a very tough rival. Timmy took his time practicing his shot. When the game was finally over, Timmy was exhausted. He fell on the ground and went to sleep. He was awoken when the coach told him that he had won!

The Pirate Ship. Drew was a pirate on a ship. It was raining a lot that day. He tried to do his business by throwing a ball in the water. Unfortunately he hit the bottom of the ship. He had to spend all of his money to fix it.
Tutor Girl. Evan was failing algebra. He took a tutor girl to help him with it. The girl was friendly and helpful. Evan began to do better. Soon he was on track to graduate!

Bandits. My aunt took me to an old abandoned asylum. There was a man hanging upside down from a rope. He was naked. He held onto the rope, not wanting to let go. It took me two tries to untangle myself.

Signed. Dan was always trying to sign his work. His boss always gave him bad grades. One day Dan's boss was sick. Dan's boss asked him to sign everything. Dan signed it with a pen and not with a paper clip.

No Show Date. Tom had a date planned for tonight. It was a fancy dinner with wine and caviar. When Tom got to the restaurant he realized that he left his wallet. He had to pay for the wrong amount of food. Tom cancelled the date.

Amazon. Lily needed to save money. She needed to find some way to earn more money. She decided to sell books on Amazon. She started to make a lot of money selling books. Now, Lily was able to buy the things she wanted.

Like Old Times. Nancy was in the mood for old times' sake. She went to her favorite Irish pub and ordered a pint of Guinness. She was very impressed with the selection of bottles. She couldn't wait to get home and start drinking again. She'll always remember this night, and her favorite time of day.

Counting Change. Dina decided she would change her car's oil. She filled her car up with gas and went to the auto parts store. After turning in her check, she went back home. While unpacking, she saw a lot of change in the car. Dina felt sad when she realized she wasted $20 on oil change.

Dave's Music Store. Dave loved music. He had an extensive collection of CDs and music tapes. One day, he decided to start a music store. After searching for many months, Dave had nothing to sell. Finally, after many months, Dave found the perfect CD to open for sale.
Having Wine. Tim was at a wine tasting. He was having fun drinking wine. A group of guys was staring at him. They started to yell at him. Tim turned around and ran away.

Jack Instructs His Barber. Jack has decided that he wants to learn how to be a barber. He takes his new skills and practices every day. Jack finally takes a job as a barber. He loves being a barber. Jack is happy he got his first job as a barber.

The Painter. Troy was a great painter. He would paint all day and night for his clients. One client was an old man and he was upset he couldn't paint for him. Troy came up with a plan. He painted on the man's wall with glitter to make him happy.
New scarf. I got a scarf last week. It was purple. It was very cute. I wore it out this week. Everyone loved it.

Water. I decided to start jogging. When I was halfway through, I got a cramp. I ran to the nearest bathroom to take some water. I started drinking from the bottle and felt better. Afterwards, I was able to run the rest of the day.
Hungry. Evan was very hungry. But he hadn't eaten in days. He went online to look up restaurants near him. He discovered a vegan restaurant. Evan ate there and realized it wasn't what he expected.

No Party Guests. My girlfriend has never been to a party. She asked me to go to a friend's party, and I agreed. The party was going to be at an apartment building. I had to be careful since it was near the street. I decided not to go to the party after all.

Chickens. Bobby was out hunting one afternoon. He saw a group of chicks in his field of vision. Bobby pointed at one chick and waited. The chick pecked at Bobby's ear and bit it! Bobby was so frightened that he had to run home quickly.

Melting. One of the kids was playing basketball with her friends. They went outside and started to play. When the sun started to set, they all huddled by the pool. They were sad to see the sun was no longer shining. They sat in the pool and relaxed and looked at the night sky.

Sock escapade. Kelly's daughter wanted to play dress up. So Kelly got a bunch of socks to put in her dresser. Kelly put on her favorite dress and walked around the room. Her daughter made lots of noise and made her laugh. Finally Kelly was able to put all the socks in the dresser.

Weight Lifting. Caleb wanted to get in shape. He decided to lift weights. Caleb's neighbor challenged him to a bench press. After working hard, Caleb bench pressed 200 pounds. Caleb lost 20 pounds and got into great shape.

The Dog. Lily went to the dog park with her friends. She was walking around the area and seeing all the dogs. Lily saw a cute dog and fell in love. Lily then went up to pet the dog and it licked her face. She decided to take the dog home and he became her new friend.
watching tv. I have always loved tv. I decided to become a tv watcher. I would go out and buy a bunch of tv shows. I would read them, and try them all. After years of watching tv, I still love it!

The Horse. The man bought a new horse. The horse was very well trained. It was a challenge for the rider to learn the horse's tricks. The man showed the horse tricks at a dinner party. The man felt proud of his horse.

Thanksgiving Session Ruined. Today is my parents' annual Thanksgiving meeting. At one point, we were told someone was ill. I tried to go through the meeting. I was trying to cheer them up before they made me stay. Afterwards, I was escorted out by security.
Computer. Kevin wanted a new computer. He asked all of his friends for help. Kevin's friends gave him advice. Kevin got a job with a computer store. Kevin bought a new computer.

escaped. Tina's cat was very mischievous. It would run into the room when it saw something scary. Tina put up posters to warn people. One day her cat got out and escaped from the house. Tina was very upset that it escaped so easily.

Eric's Brunch Date. Eric was going on a date. He wanted to do something special to impress her. Eric had always liked his sister. So he decided to bring her lunch on their date. Eric's sister told him she had a great time.

Amber's Halloween. Amber wanted to be a cat for Halloween. She did not have the money to buy a costume. She decided to do something creative instead. She made a scary mask and wore it to school the next day. Everyone was very impressed with her frightful costume!
Bob Goes Sledding. Bob went sledding in the snow. His friends all went with him. They all went down the same hill. They all got in the same accident. Bob's sled flipped over on its side.
Cards. Rory went to the post office to print money. She found a $1 bill and a $5 bill. The clerk offered her a $2 bill. She declined the offer. Rory returned with the $2 bill.

The Vase. Janice was walking around her house. She was carrying a vase on her arm. Janice bumped into a lamp. The vase fell and broke on the floor. Janice picked up the broken pieces and fixed the vase.

Math. Bill has always been bad at math. He struggled in college because of it. He took a math course in high school to get his grade up. He did very well in the class. Now he can pass his math test easily.

Unjust Justice. My mother and I bought a fish from the pet store. We went to the pond to feed it. I tried to get some worms in my hand. I was attacked by a snake and my hand was bitten. The store refused to give me a refund.
Well Done. I ate a burger with fries. It was really well done. I didn't know I could get food poisoning from it. I had to go the store to buy medicine. I hope my doctor fixes my food poisoning.

Too Much to Drink. Jack and Ted went on a hike. They brought all their water from the top of the mountain. They drank down the entire bottle in only three hours. They got so drunk that they started to hallucinate. They were sent back to the campground.

Elephants. Jane liked to go elephant watching with her boyfriend. They would go to the zoo on weekends and stay overnight. Jane had never seen one up close. One day he took her to an elephant farm. Jane was glad she had finally seen one up close.

The Writer. Sasha was a new writer in college. She loved writing so much that she decided to get her writing recognized. She wrote many short stories and submitted them to magazines. Soon, she had several rejections. She decided to just start her own magazine instead.
Boat ride. I got on the boat. I got off the boat. I climbed in the boat. I climbed on the boat. I had a great day.

Ascension. Maurice and his friends were on the lake. They had just arrived when their boat got stuck. It was really dark so they decided to get on top of it. The next morning they found the boat floating above the water. The boys climbed onto it and were so happy.

Carl Corn. My sister in law's parents used to grow corn in their field in Iowa. It was called Carl's corn or corn. There were a few other crops grown by her parents. In the 1970s the family moved to Iowa and the field was empty. She bought a farm and started growing corn there.

Special B-Day. Jim got his first tattoo when he was sixteen. He really liked the design. Jim's parents took him to the doctor to get it removed. Jim hated his new tattoo. He got another one, but hated it too.

Bike. Mike was in a hurry and did not want to wait. He called up a friend to help him ride to work. The friend drove Mike to work on a motorcycle. Mike was so excited he jumped out of the car and ran after the friend. The friend laughed and the bike got away from Mike.

Jack Goes to the Dentist. Jack wasn't feeling well. His parents were worried he wouldn't get to go to the dentist. Jack called the dentist for an appointment. The dentist was able to schedule Jack for an x-ray. The dentist fixed Jack's problem and Jack was happy.
Vacation. Tim had never been on vacation. He decided to get a job in the summer. He decided to start working for a company. Tim saved all of his money. Finally, he could take a vacation!
Ugly Baby. Sue was pregnant. She was excited to give birth. Her stomach was in the wrong spot. Her and her husband tried to push it out with the baby. Unfortunately, it was stuck and she was born.
The Hike. The Boy Scouts went on a hike. They were going to get a chocolate prize. They hiked for three hours. When they got to the campsite they had a great time. The Boy Scouts had a great hike.

Honeymoon Rodents. I am an avid kayaker. My best friends from work kayak every weekend. They go to places with boat ramps. We go up to eight miles inland. They are a lot less adventurous when they don't kayak.

Mama's Bell Tower. The Bell Tower was a small house on a hill. Mama Bell's family was always there to visit. When she was a little girl she made a wish. She asked her daddy to build her a beautiful bell tower. His response was to build her a house the Bell Tower.

Fire Alarm. A few minutes ago, the fire alarm went off in our building. It went off and we all panicked. I took my shirt off, grabbed my coat, and went outside. I told all of my coworkers to evacuate the building. After we evacuated, I ran inside, called the fire department, and was safe.

dicing chef. Beth had just started out on her new job. Her first day on the job she learned how to dice. She worked very hard at learning how to dice. After she got all the details down she brought it to the boss. He was impressed and Beth was so proud of herself.

Bailey. Bailey loved to bake. Bailey decided to try to bake some cookies. However, Bailey's cookies turned out not to be very good. Bailey decided that baking wasn't for her. Bailey decided that baking wasn't for her.

Squirrel!. Every night, James heard a loud noise outside. He always thought it was just his dog barking. One night, James decided to investigate. He saw his neighbor's dog had injured his squirrel. James quickly brought the injured squirrel to the vet.
Missed Flight. Tom was on a business trip. He decided to take a flight. While in flight he missed his flight. It was the end of the trip. Tom was disappointed and decided not to go again.

Tummy Ache. Candy was eating at her favorite restaurant. She ordered spaghetti and chicken. Candy's food started to taste odd. She looked at the bill and noticed the price had gone up. Her new bill was $75 for her spaghetti and $90 for her chicken!
Poor Toby. Toby had been asked to clean his house. Toby started cleaning. But then his hands got dirty. Toby decided not to finish cleaning. He decided to stay home from cleaning.

Escape From Spanish Camp. One summer, the camp staff put a Spanish speaking woman on the grounds. She was supposed to be quiet and not speak Spanish at all. On her first day, she took a big group of kids and drank beer. They told her they didn't want her to be there, because they were scared. Luckily, her mother said they could leave if she didn't speak Spanish.

beautiful. Kelly's parents told her she was ugly. So Kelly had to change her name to Jane. She was so upset that she threw a fit. Kelly cried so much and said bad words. But her parents found the story to be adorable and cute.
Rufus Rides the Bus. Rufus wants to get to his job in an hour. He looks online for a bus to take him to work. Rufus finds a bus he likes. He boards the bus. Rufus gets to work in an hour.

Time Goes. Gina and her siblings were waiting for her grandma in the car. She hadn't returned from school for two days. She didn't have a ride to a doctor's appointment. She would be alone for the first time this summer. Gina felt like she'd be homeschooled for the first time.

Dirty Sheets. Jane's mom was always changing the sheets. Jane decided she would change them to be better. She changed them to a soft and comfy fabric. After that, Jane's mom always made better sheets. Now Jane can sleep in her own bed.
Apple picking. Last week I decided to go apple picking. The first five or six acres were free. I went to the last five or six acres. I had a blast. I decided I would come back for more.

Popcorn Problems. The Johnson family went out to eat. They went to a restaurant that had a giant popcorn machine. It was a big deal to use the machine. They were trying to figure out the right way to microwave it. Eventually they realized that there were no proper ways to do it.
Peachy. Tori was shopping in the mall. She bought a lot of makeup. She tried it on but it didn't make her skin look very nice. She went home with the ugly makeup. She was so glad to remove it!

Missed Trip. Karen forgot to get her flight to the airport before her flight. She decided to go to the airport on her day off. When she arrived at the airport it was already closed. Karen had to stay at home on the weekend. She spent her weekend partying with her friends instead.

Christmas Vacation. Mary took her family to Disney World for Christmas Vacation. They spent a week relaxing and watching fireworks. Mary wanted to spend time with her family before they returned home. The family enjoyed the rest of the trip. They all vowed to spend Christmas Vacation together.

Carlsbad Caverns. Carlsbad Caverns was a small town on the east coast. Carlsbad had a lot of abandoned buildings and mines. It had once been a very large underground cavern. One day, Carlsbad was hit by a tornado. Carlsbad was abandoned for many years and never recovered.

Man from peru. Tina went to Peru with her husband. They were visiting their granddaughter's family. Tina decided to take a nap. When she woke up she found her daughter had taken over her room. Her daughter was reading her diary and Tina was horrified!

Garbage Day. It was garbage day, and the kids were looking forward to it. They'd already dug up a bunch of their own garbage. They had the whole house covered in their detritus. Finally, they decided they would clean the garage. It was a lot easier than digging up all their own garbage!

The Trip. The family was going on a trip! They would be going on a boat to the beach. They had heard great things about it, but they hadn't been. The boat was beautiful. They had fun on the boat and had a great time.

Gingerbread. Bob's grandmother had told him he should eat something sweet. He always did as his grandmother had said. But one day he was out of milk. So he got some sugar. When he tried it, he spit it out.

Stepparent Blues. My parents had three kids when I was a teenager. It was the worst thing that could happen to a young girl. I became friends with the eldest one and he liked me. He asked me to get rid of the youngest one. I refused and she left.
My Best Friend. My friend Bill is overweight. Bill was an alcoholic. Bill passed away at the young age of forty five. I found his obituary in the paper and felt sad. Bill is my best friend.

Soda. Ethan had a bad cold. He went to the store to buy some medicine. He decided to buy a case of sugary pop. When he got home he drank all the pop. He felt better, but he couldn't sleep the rest of the day.

Home is best. Sue's mom had passed away recently. Her dad kept her home all alone. Sue began to think that she should have lived with her. Her dad felt that it was best for her to move on. Sue finally left her mom's house for her own safety.

Indirect Attack. Kim sat on a bench in front of her class. An elderly man walked on the bench next to her. He didn't notice that Kim was sitting. He bumped into her and knocked her down. He continued to walk on the bench after this.

Two More Books. Jim was a huge fan of the works of Edgar Allan Poe. He bought a large quantity of his favorite author's collected works. He took them to his local library and checked out books on each. He found a book on Edgar Allan Poe, one that was out of print. He brought the book back to the library and they read it for him.

Late Mail. Dan was expecting a package for Friday. However, when he woke up on Friday morning, he saw that it was not there. Dan called the post office and complained. Dan waited patiently for his package to arrive. Dan was happy when he got his package and a thank-you note in the mail.
Daily Walk. Jane and her family were visiting a farm. They were walking along a field. They were stopping to pick up eggs. A farmer walked out from the barn. Jane and her family ran after him.

The Big Date. Amy was on a date with Mark at the mall. Mark was tall and muscular and liked her more than anything. She had been waiting for this date for weeks. Mark finally showed up. Amy knew she had made the right decision to spend time with Mark.

Giving up Tinder. Gina was talking on her phone. She had never found a date for a long term relationship. She was not sure what to do about Tinder. Gina began to worry that her options were too limited. She gave up on Tinder and was able to meet someone at a restaurant.

Conference call. My phone rang while I was working at a call center. It was a conference call. The boss was speaking over the speakerphone. I was on the speakerphone and it was very loud. I had a hard time focusing on the task at hand.

New Additional. Jan was a good singer. She had a new song written for her band. She wanted to get the song on the radio. The radio stations played it at a time when Jan wasn't available. Jan's song went on the air and everyone loved it.

Eggs. Sam decided to make scrambled eggs for dinner. He mixed all the ingredients together and heated the pan. Once the pan was hot, he placed the eggs in the pan. He watched as they scrambled and splattered. His guests were impressed with his cooking skills.

Hurricane Gloria. The weatherman called Hurricane Gloria. The local tv station came in to cover the storm. The hurricane did a lot of damage to many parts of the town. Many roads were closed for many hours. Hurricane Gloria was downgraded to a tropical storm.

Train. Sasha wanted to learn how to ride a train. She signed up for a class at the local community college. Sasha spent every day riding on the local train. After a year, Sasha was able to be proficient at riding. Sasha was able to travel the world on the train.
Bad weather. The snow was finally gone. Tina decided to go for a walk. She loved to run in the snow. Unfortunately the weather turned out to be really cold. She was too cold to run.

party all night. Cameron went out with some friends for a party. He was very thirsty so he drank a lot of water. The next day he was very thirsty so he went to get water. The water came up to his mouth and he had to spit it out. Cameron's friends teased him about it for a while.

Fallen. Ida's toddler ran to her in the middle of the night. She shrieked, but she was too tired to go find him. She called his name and then woke him up, but he was still gone. Ida's dad had to go looking for him for hours. After he found Ida, he found her toddler asleep on the couch.
Jake buys a car. Jake had always wanted a new car. He always saved up for a new one. Finally he decided to buy one. He was shocked at how good it was in his eyes. Jake loved his new car.
Chile. Neil was visiting Chile. He had heard the people spoke Tagalog. Neil's tour guide told him about the language. Neil thought the locals were annoying. He wished he could understand them.
Restaurant. Tom was hungry. He went to the local pizza parlor. Tom ate a slice of pizza. He loved the flavor. Tom was glad he got some pizza.

Jasper Uses Air Conditioning. Jasper notices that his apartment has become hot. He decides to try and use an air conditioner. Finally Jasper feels cool and comfortable. He decides to stay in his apartment even cooler. It is worth the effort.

Training for a Race. I woke up this morning ready to go for a run. My parents told me I needed to get in shape. I got into a gym with a running track. I began running and jogging. By the end of the day I felt great!

Better with Glasses. Ike bought a new pair of glasses. And he realized that he needed them to be better with his vision. He asked a neighbor for help reading the sidewalk. And the neighbor helped him out. Ike was so glad he hired the neighbor for helping with reading.

New apartment. My parents decided to buy a new apartment. I didn't realize they didn't have the money for a down payment. I called my mom to ask her what I could do to help. She said she needed money for the down payment, but I wanted to help too. I spent the next month mowing lawns for my family and we made the money.

The Unnoticed Costume. Candy wanted to dress up for Halloween. Candy went to the costume store and bought a fake cat. Candy left the store. Candy arrived home to find her cat sleeping on the floor. Candy noticed her cat had a broken leg and called the hospital.
100 lb. weight loss. I wanted to lose weight. I tried to diet, but I never really succeeded. So I decided to take a weight loss class. I worked out for two weeks. I lost 100 lbs.

New Game. Jim decided to buy a new board game. It was a board game he had never played before. Jim found out he could not keep the game from getting too messy. The game ended up being very long and unorganized. Jim decided to give the board game to his friend who enjoyed it.
The Diploma. I took my daughter to my friend's graduation. I got a diploma for her. She was so proud. She presented it to her family. They were so proud too!

The Leftovers. Gina hadn't cooked a meal in months. But her grandma had promised she could eat her leftover french fries. Gina's mother suggested they use some for burgers. Gina hated hamburgers, but she liked them on a dinnertime budget. She knew she would need to do the dishes more often.

Catsup. Kia had to feed the family's cat. But she felt terrible, because the cat was fussy! Then she decided to fill a cat carrier with cat food. When she got to the cat, the cat gobbled it up like it was candy! Kia decided catsup would be a great substitute for cat food!
Nervous Edna. Edna was so nervous to have her first baby. She went into the hospital. She was afraid of the baby getting sick. Edna gave birth naturally. She was very proud of herself.

Bob Gets Contacts. Bob wanted to get a new pair of contacts. He went to a local drugstore. He browsed a variety of colors and styles. He finally picked one pair he liked. Bob purchased the new contacts.
Sleep Over. Tom had a sleepover. He didn't sleep all night. The next day Tom was grumpy. He decided to be more careful. The next day he was more patient and relaxed.

Carl. Carl always wanted a girlfriend. He thought he was very good at playing guitar. One day he found a beautiful girl at a school concert. He played guitar for her and told all of his friends. They all loved Carl.

Deep Cut. I decided to eat dinner after work. I bought myself a knife and a cutting board. After the meal, I accidentally cut myself with the knife. The blood began to flow into my shirt and pants. I decided to go back to bed instead of getting mad.

produce. Lucy woke up one morning and ran to the fridge. Her mom brought some fresh fruit and vegetables from the store. Lucy peeled the carrots and pears off of the vines. She peeled the potatoes as well. After eating, she looked at the empty glass in the fridge.

Cats. Ivan and his brothers got bored one day. So they decided to play a game of cat-hunting. They spent all day and night looking for the right cats. They never found any. But then they got very bored and went home.

Hair Cut. Diane has long, natural brown hair. She decided to get her hair cut for her big day in a bun. She tried to be gentle with it as she chopped it. Diane's hair was a little messy to her surprise. Diane had to cut a quarter off before her hair fell out.

Anaconda. It was a beautiful, hot day. Beth went outside to look at the beautiful flowers. Beth stepped out onto a cliff and stood there. Beth was amazed by the beautiful view. Beth called her mother and told her that she had seen anaconda flowers.

The Surprise. Cayla was very nervous. She had a huge audition for the school play. She got on stage and performed her part perfectly. It wasn't long before everyone in the theater gasped. Cayla had done a wonderful job and won the role.

View from the top. Jim looked out over the mountains in his cabin. He heard some noise and looked up. He saw a family of deer run down the road. He ran to get the deer and shot it. Jim drove to a nearby forest to shoot the deer.

A pair of shoes. Nancy needed to find a new pair of shoes. She did not have enough money. She started to sell cookies to make some money. She put up fliers in her neighborhood to sell. Nancy ended up selling one hundred boxes of cookies!

Video Store. Joey was visiting his grandparents with his grandma. Joey's grandma liked to take him to the video store. Joey went to the video store and purchased a ton of movies. Joey and his grandma went home that day to relax. Joey is glad that his grandma took him to the video store.
food fight. Joe was at a restaurant. He was eating some chicken. Then he noticed a few people fighting. Joe decided to leave. He wasn't sure if he should, but he did.

A Better Lunch. Sara wanted to be more conscious of her food. She tried making better lunch meat choices. She also tried making better soup. Sara's friends liked her suggestions. They all got to eat a great lunch!

Counterattack. I was sitting at lunch when a small group of us sat around a table. A person wanted to talk, but no one could find their card. We tried to decide who would talk first. Since everyone wanted the conversation, we all started speaking at once. By the time we finished, everyone felt better about the situation.

ADHD. My cousin went to visit me. He had been having trouble sleeping lately. We sat on my couch and talked. He told me about his struggles with ADHD. We talked about how much he wanted to change his life.
The Inept Football Team. The players were getting ready to play the big game. They had been practicing all week. The coach told them to get ready. The players all got ready. The team won the game.

Lego Designer. Troy loves designing toys. He is really good at it. He plans on becoming a professional Lego designer. He applies to be a model maker in his town. Troy is accepted and now makes a living off of his love of Lego.

The Dining Set. Kenny's parents bought him a fancy dining set. It was the best thing he'd ever had. Kenny was too much for it and ate away at it. Kenny hated it so much he wouldn't eat it again. His parents didn't mind and bought him something else.
New Shoes. Lacy went shopping. She loved shoes. She wanted to buy a new pair. She finally found the perfect pair. She bought them and loved them.
Wife. Gina and her brother were talking. Gina's family didn't like him anymore. He asked if they wanted a divorce. Gina was silent, but she knew he wanted the divorce. Gina agreed to the divorce.

The New Garden. Sally wanted to grow veggies. She went to the garden store and bought a bunch of seeds. She planted the seeds in her garden. She watered them everyday and they grew. Her garden was the prettiest in the neighborhood.

Angela 4. Angela was trying to get a baby. She wanted to have twins! But after years of trying, she couldn't conceive. Finally she and her husband decided to adopt a child. Now Angela and her baby are happy!

School Board Victory. In 2012, the School Board passed a new policy that requires school employees to wear uniforms. The policy also mandates that the board hold a school elections every three years. The last school election was held in November of 2012. In the end, the board was split evenly between two candidates. The two candidates were able to secure enough votes to pass the policy.
Coffee Break. Tom was in class at school. He was drinking coffee on his desk. He started getting nervous about school. He started drinking more and more coffee. Eventually he passed out in class.

Portia Plays Badminton. Portia was playing badminton with her friends. They were playing for money. Portia's ball went flying and hit another ball. That ball broke into two and the other went flying. Portia's badminton team won the game!

Veronica's Bush. Veronica was very poor. She bought a huge old oak tree from the hardware store. It had been damaged by many storms and fell many times. The tree was in bad shape. Veronica decided to leave it alone and sell it for some cash.

Mom and the Car. Mary drove her father's car at the end of the day. She loved that car, and she planned to get another one for him. One day the car's engine quit making a noise. Mary's father didn't know what was wrong, but he needed help. Mary took him to the shop, where he explained his problem.

Breaking the laptop. Jace was trying to finish an essay for school. His laptop was running slowly. Jace took the laptop to his mother's. His mother paid for the computer. Jace was able to finish his essay on time.

Jane's Diary. Jane kept a diary with her information. The information she wrote in the diary were accurate. She was told that the information was wrong by her mother. Jane's mother told her that the information in the diary was wrong. Jane told her daughter that she was wrong and it was true.

The Basketball Game. I took my son to the school basketball game. He loves the game of basketball. I was excited to watch him play. After the game, he wanted to come back the next day. We decided to go to the park.
